author: {'steamid': '76561198052698261', 'num_games_owned': 755, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 842, 'last_played': 1597411802}
review: Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy is a mix between a 3D platformer and a puzzle solving adventure, with a beautiful pacing between the two. Sphinx controls as a hero should, with a double jump, high sprinting speed, a shield, blowpipe, and shield, whilst playing as the mummy will have you solving puzzles in the Castle of Uruk, using fire, electricity, invisibility, copies of yourself, and others, to solve beautifully crafted puzzles, all whilst listening to an incredible soundtrack. This one is a must-have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198243004182', 'num_games_owned': 58, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 909, 'last_played': 1650480455}
review:
Uno de los Mejores Juegos que gracias a dios pude conocerlo y jugarlo

La jugábilidad es un poco difícil no mucho pero si me equivoco apenas me muero Jaja eso me encanta que se le suba la dificultad por jugarlo en Pc me parece hermoso el juego que pena no se hiciera muy famoso por lo que veo Seria genial que hicieran mas juegos de este tipo realmente es una maravilla este hermoso juego se lo recomiendo a todos los que conozco tienes horas de diversión para jugarlo la verdad (Admito que me vicie tanto que casi hago un speedrun sin querer Jaja) Si algún día se me da la posibilidad voy a ser un vídeo o una serie a este juego realmente me parece una obra maestra

author: {'steamid': '76561198021534613', 'num_games_owned': 1498, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1323, 'last_played': 1586181058}
review:
Eis um jogo que passa completamente despercebido. Não fosse eu ter um disco aleatório de demos da PS2 há 30 anos atrás, não teria sequer ideia de que o jogo existe. Mas eu tinha o tal disco, e consequentemente, reconheci o dito jogo quando o vi nos saldos do Steam. E esta é a história de "How I met your mummy".

O primeiro aspecto positivo que quero realçar é o design das personagens. São fixes e são memoráveis. Afinal de contas, o jogo persistiu na minha memória desde a era da PS2. Havia vários outros jogos de plataformas com mascotes, e então era natural que o Sphinx, com a sua cara de bad boy rebelde que não acaba os legumes ao jantar e que tira dois pacotes de leite com chocolate no final do recreio, em vez do um a que tem direito, não tenha tido tanta popularidade como os Ratchets ou os Marios, seus contemporâneos.

Note-se, então, que esta versão é um ligeiro remaster dessas versões da década passada. É compatível com comando XBox One, felizmente. Tem achievements, e aumenta a resolução dos modelos e das texturas, mas nota-se perfeitamente que o esqueleto é antigo.

E por falar em esqueleto antigo! Este jogo desenrola-se no antigo Egipto. Tem dois protagonistas: um jovem com cauda de leão chamado Sphinx e um outro rapaz que fica transformado numa múmia amaldiçoada.
Acho um bocado estranho que, no jogo todo, ninguém comente sobre o nome dele... "Prazer em conhecê-lo, Sphi... Espera lá, Sphinx, tipo esfinge? Tipo aqueles monumentos? E aquele é o teu amigo Pirâmide, ou quê?". Acho que poderia ter havido mais esforço no nome, pronto.

Quanto ao jogo em si, é do género CAIRO (Characters Acting Independently but Rotating Occasionally), e é sobretudo feito de plataformas, exploração, combate assim-assim, e elementos de Metroidvania ou RPG-à-la-Zelda, em que novas habilidades desbloqueadas ao longo do jogo abrem novos caminhos ou níveis inteiros.

A história é um bocado dramática, e obviamente o mauzão é o deus Set, mas felizmente não se leva demasiado a sério. Normalmente os vilões querem dominar o mundo, destrui-lo ou uni-lo. Mas aqui, o Nilo é apenas um rio!
 
As missões vão alternando entre os protagonistas, que têm estilos de jogo bastante distintos.
Os níveis com o Sphinx têm combate, exploração, diálogos e um mundo mais ou menos aberto. Os níveis com a múmia são à base de puzzles. A múmia é basicamente um zombie imortal, e para resolver os puzzles temos de nos incinerar para destruir obstáculos, electrificar para activar mecanismos, ou ser esmagados por uma pedra gigante ao ponto de ficarmos 2D, para passar por entre grades.
É divertido e, parece-me, bastante original.

As missões (ou capítulos) são relativamente longas e alternam seguindo uma ordem linear, ou seja, não é estilo co-op nem em tempo semi-real como o GTA5. Os dois protagonistas vão lentamente cooperando à distância para proteger o mundo da devastação.

A propósito, há um elemento particularmente interessante, que é a possibilidade de capturar e usar monstros em combate. Como se fossem, digamos... monstros... de bolso! Usando escaravelhos de captura, podemos coleccionar os inimigos que combatemos ao longo do jogo. Se o Pokémon já tem pontos de moralidade questionáveis, então aqui é como se as pokébolas também fossem seres vivos!

Seja como for, capturar os inimigos tem duas vantagens. Uma é que podemos doar espécimes ao museu, em troca de recompensas. Outra é que podemos usá-los em combate ou para encontrar segredos. Por exemplo, um dos bichos é o "Fire Armadillo", que, depois de capturado, pode ser usado para destruir obstáculos de madeira com as suas chamas. Sucede que ele depois explode e falece, mas enfim, sempre podemos voltar e capturar mais dos seus familiares, portanto não faz mal...
Antes de acabar o jogo fiz questão de capturar todos os bichos e completar o meu Pokédex. Acho que foi uma sidequest interessante.

Recomendado em 2020, mas seria ainda mais extremamente super mega recomendado na altura em que saiu. Felizmente, ainda vão a tempo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198299160850', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 7743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2797, 'last_played': 1700772201}
review:
I've been playing this master piece about once a year give or take since I was a teen and this port is perfect. I can Gush about the art, music, level and character design in this game easily so I'll start with the stuff I don't gush about.

The combat itself is pretty basic, nothing out of the box but still fun, and with the capture beetles you have a pokemon/catch em all sorta twist that makes it more fun and adds another element to it.
The story/plot is great - nothing mind blowing that I'd rant and rave about but definitely good/interesting.
The controls aren't always the greatest thing in the world but they're definitely above par for PS2 era.
The Puzzles aren't hard but they make you think, and they are very unique and fun.

Now for the gush. The art/level design and atmosphere put into this game is Amazing and so well done, you can take a screenshot almost anywhere and it'll have a completely unique vibe; and be gorgeous.
You can tell a lot of thought and work went into the music, and that they probably sat down and said "what should the player hear and when", the same way you can tell with Portal, Mirrors Edge and Deus Ex.
All the characters and enemies feel unique, in look and personality.

In general a lot of Imagination and personality was put into this game and it shows. definitely worth the 15 bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198243396510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1012, 'last_played': 1660842590}
review:
I have a lot of nostalgia for this old game. I grew up with it. I'm very happy to see it remastered on steam for PC, now I can hold on to it forever.  I used to originally play this game on the PS2 10-15 years ago. If anyone has good memories playing this game when it first came out, I would totally recommend buying this 100%. It's amazing to see this game still alive on PC with HD graphics. It even got a port to the Nintendo Switch!

This game has a great ancient Egyptian mythology setting with it's own unique lore and concepts.  They even have locations named after real life Egyptian cities. Heliopolis was a real city. Abydos is a real city still standing today. One of the Jewelry exhibits mentioned the location of Thebes. The plot involved ancient Egyptian cultural names, references, gods, and creatures such as Osiris, Set, Anubis, Sphinx, Imhotep, and Horus.

I just wish they made a sequel for this game. The developers obviously intended for a sequel to close the story. The ending was left on a cliff hanger. I won't spoil the ending but they made it so that it was set up for a sequel. But it seems that the game was not commercially successful enough for a sequel. I hope that someone could at least revive the concept of capturing monsters along with the Egyptian mythology theme. Getting to find, hunt, capture, buy, sell, donate, and collect monsters is such a great gameplay concept. I hope they can at least bring this concept back on a next-gen console game. Or maybe they came remake this game and it's concepts on a future console. 

There are a few things the original vanilla game could have improved upon: a lack of voice acting, a lack of meaningful protagonist dialogue, sometimes it isn't obvious on what to do next so if you don't know what you are doing then you might get stuck on a puzzle. I can imagine a lot of people did not finish this game originally when it came out because they got stuck on an area/puzzle and could not figure out what to do because there were no good in-game hints.  There is a part in the game where you are supposed to buy a monster from a shop in Abydos and then donate it to the museum in order to further progress in the game and story, yet there are absolutely no hints at all that the player is supposed to do this. You're just going to have to figure it out on your own along with many other things.

As for the port itself, the game was upgraded with High Definition graphics so now it looks better than ever! There is so much more detail in the textures now, it looks beautiful. In some settings you can see the light beams shining into palaces and in other settings in the distance you can see pyramids. However, the high level of graphics causes the game to freeze quit frequently, and this is not typical on my PC as it runs other next-gen games on 11 GB of RAM very smoothly. If the game is laggy, just crank down the graphic settings in the menu and/or adjust the resolution. Also, there is a glitch for the soundrack music in the background. Sometimes after an hour or two of playing the game the music soundtrack in the background will will stop playing and it will sometimes have weird audio noises and hiccups. It does not stop the progress of the game but it is annoying enough to make me quit then restart the game. The vibe of the game really dies down if the music in the background stops playing. Other than that this is a great port that lets me relive this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985969658', 'num_games_owned': 1012, 'num_reviews': 690, 'playtime_forever': 2699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2699, 'last_played': 1590567051}
review:
Definitely was fooled by this one. The reviews were so positive and an early 2000 3d adventure game i was expecting crash or spyro or jak and dexter, ratchet and clank, etc. Boy was I wrong. First off, theres such a bare bones and uninteresting story it wasn't even worth paying attention to after the first 30 minutes. You switch between two characters. First off the guy that can fight, the combat sucks, you only have 1 attack so you just mash that. Then the other guy only solves puzzles which involves getting burned, electricuted, or flattened, and you use those same gimmicks every level which gets old. Most of the puzzles are overly tedious, convoluted and just not interesting or inventive but have a ton of steps that need to be done in 1 specific order. Other parts involve finding 1 small collectible in 1 corner of the very large and multi segmental zone without any waypoints, map, or any clues leading to a definite need for walkthrough unless you want to wander around forever unsure of what to do or where to go. 

The platforming is bad because this game has one of the worst cameras ever, and with the 3d and bad camera it is hard to judge distance, and sometimes your guy wont grab a ledge for no reason. Theres also no voice acting, and the levels arent very interesting. Theres just nothing fun or worthwhile to do here. Just solve annoying tedious puzzles for the sake of it and mash attack. This one should have stayed in the early 2000s where it belongs and wasn't even good by those standards based on other games of the time. 5.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041325985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1595265302}

author: {'steamid': '76561198073636789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1589748629}
review:
Compré Sphinx porque soy un gran fan de los juegos de aventura en 3d, y dada la escasez actual de este genero empecé a investigar sobre juegos de este tipo que me faltaran por probar. No voy a hablar de él comparándolo con títulos actuales puesto que seria injusto, si no comparandolo con los de su misma época.

Hablamos de un juego original que entra por la visto por su ambientación y sus protagonistas, pero no es oro todo lo que recluce. Sphinx es un juego mediocre en sus combates, en sus secciones de plataformas y en sus puzles que muchas veces caes en lo tedioso. Repito eso si lo comparo con juegos de su mismo estilo y de su misma época. Star fox adventures es más o menos igual de antiguo y siendo un juego de aventuras en 3d le da mil patadas a Sphinx en absolutamente todo y por mucho.

Significa eso que Sphinx es totalmente insastisfactorio? pues no, el juego tiene sus bondades, y pese a sus defectos logra entretener. Pero solo recomiendo su compra si te apetece mucho rememorar viejos tiempos y ya has jugado a practicamente todos los títulos simiares. Si no, hay muchas mejores opciones, Psychonauts por ejemplo es una gran alternativa de este género en pc sin necesidad de tirar de emulador.

author: {'steamid': '76561199049014963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1612666815}
review:
I remember first playing this game when it first came out! It was a Christmas gift, and it was on PS2. I remember playing it at 13 having so much fun with this game, albeit sometimes some of the glitches and disproportionate gameplay re: difficulty was indeed a challenge (that I mastered).
Playing this now on Steam has been so nostalgic for me. I've never been a PC gamer prior to playing this game on Steam (I only just downloaded it this past week, pretty much just to play this game, but I'm totally gonna play other games because I didn't realize how many games are here!) so I'm still adapting to the controls via my keyboard, but it's still super smooth (and way less glitchy than the OG console version). I feel like I'm reconnecting with my old gamer self.
I'm so so so happy that this game is here and I'm having a lot of fun!!!!!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198406729158', 'num_games_owned': 13, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1414, 'last_played': 1696941458}

author: {'steamid': '76561198085485659', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1774, 'last_played': 1680399085}
review:
Well this has been a long time coming. This game brings back so many childhood memories. My biggest question is WHERE IS THE 2ND GAME!!! A second game needs to be made. Alright enough ranting for part 2 let's get into the review. 

Let's start with the pros:

- Beautiful graphics
- Very solid story line
- Simple and easy controls
- Not too difficult (Gameplay wise)
- Excellent music
- Very fun overall

Now for the cons
- Very short (Completed it in almost less then 12 hours)
- Very little to no voice acting
- Not enough quests or things to do
- Weapon/item selection is very limited
- Lore is very weak

For the cons here is my reasoning:

"Very short" if you really focus on the main story and don't do anything else, you can easily beat this game in about 12 hours or less. If you want to 100% the game, about 13 hours or more.

"Very little to no voice acting" the game depends on very heavy dialogue reading, some of the characters make specific noises but all of it is reading.

"Not enough quests/things to do" what I mean by this is the game is very limited when it comes to fun things to do. There are four different mini games that can all be beaten in less then an hour. And you can fill the museum with monsters and jewels (the jewels are story based). Essentially, there are little quests that you can do but they rely on moving forward with the story.

"Weapon/Item selection is very limited" all the items in the game have some sort of a connection with the story (obviously), but there are really no items that you can get for fun. There are no other weapons that you can acquire but aren't necessary to acquire. There are no items that are just there for fun.

"Lore is very weak" this one is kind of obvious. What do we know about Sphinx? (other than he is a demi-god) who are his parents? Where did he come from? How did he become part of the prophecy? It's little things like that is what puts character depth into a game and makes it more worth investing in if we know who we are playing as rather than knowing that his only main purpose is too destroy evil.


And that's the end of this review. Overall this is a super fun game, I have only had this game for a few days and I already beat it twice. If you are looking for a casual, fun, action/puzzle, laid back "Legend of Zelda" clone. Then this is your game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307903324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1587202509}
review:
Porting perfetto di un gioco che ricordavo con molta nostalgia. Sono sorpresa di come sia invecchiato bene. Consigliato soprattutto per l'accattivante e suggestiva rivisitazione dell'Antico Egitto e della sua mitologia. La storia del gioco è sorprendentemente piacevole da seguire, grazie anche ad un cast di personaggi ben assortito e caratterizzato. Nel complesso il gioco non presenta un elevato livello di sfida, ma è molto divertente, si lascia giocare anche se il gameplay, per certi aspetti, è ciò che più di tutto sente il peso degli anni (stiamo comunque parlando di un action-adventure del 2003) ma gli enigmi sono abbastanza soddisfacenti. Il doppiaggio è completamente assente. 
Sono del parere che meriterebbe di essere più conosciuto.
A differenza di altri giochi supporta alla perfezione anche il Dualshock della PS4, gira benissimo persino su un Mac del 2012.
Voto: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198853414330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2344, 'last_played': 1590001472}
review: Öncelikle oyuna verdiğim paraya ve zamana değdi. Ben, oyun oynarken çok gezen,araştıran; ince eleyip sık dokuyan biri olduğum için yaklaşık 40 saatte oyunu bitirdim. Tabii siz eğer sadece oyundaki hikaye görevlerini yaparak oynayan biriyseniz 15-20 saat civarında bitirebilirsiniz. Oyunun genel yapısından bahsetmem gerekirse; oyunu iki karakterle oynuyorsunuz: Sfenks ve Tutankamon. Sfenks ile hikayenin aksiyon tarafını yürütürken; Tutankamon ile daha çok bulmaca odaklı bir serüven yaşıyorsunuz. Oyunda ilerledikçe çeşitli görev ve yetenek maddeleri kazanıyorsunuz. Görev maddeleri kullanılamaz olup bir yerden alıp başka bir yere teslim edilen maddelerdir. Yetenek maddelerini oyun içerisinde işinize yarayacak yerlerde kullanabiliyorsunuz. Örneğin; yakalama böceği isimli bir madde ile karşınıza çıkan canlıları yakalayabiliyorsunuz veya dart oklarını çeşitli nesne ve canlılara atabiliyorsunuz. Oyunda biri final olmak üzere dört adet patron savaşı bulunuyor. Oyunun genel yapısı hakkında söyleyebileceklerim bunlar olup; platform veya aksiyon-macera tarzında oyun seven herkese bu oyunu öneriyorum.

author: {'steamid': '76561198293440819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 740, 'last_played': 1692577127}
review:
This game, despite being almost sixteen years old, holds up pretty well.

The gameplay is pretty simple, combat sections alternated by puzzle solving and roaming in a semi-open world.

The story is good, much better if experienced as a kid (kids love ancient Egypt, at least I did).

And the soundtrack is just beautiful.

Alas, there is one thing that really needs to be fixed:

[spoiler] We need a sequel [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198009027228', 'num_games_owned': 1136, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1584855612}
review:
NOTE: I did not play this at release. This is my first time.

Do you like Prince of Persia, Zelda or Soul Reaver? How about combat that is weirdly too well done for such an old game? Or maybe crazy giant environments full of insane Egyptian architecture? Do you have crippling OCD and love pulling switches and collecting keys? If you answered yes to any of these questions, Sphinx may be the game for you. 

Don't be fooled by it's cartoony characters, Sphinx has much more in common with something like Soul Reaver or Shadow Man than, say, Spyro. This is a game focused on Egyptian mythology with great combat, fun platforming and a nice presentation.  The highlight of the game is definitely the level design and architecture, Some of the areas you encounter are absolutely mind boggling, recalling the level design of Ico or SotC.

If you are a fan of classic action platforms, I think this is a must have. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013728022', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 914, 'last_played': 1578692633}
review:
Great action RPG. The puzzles with Tut really did make me chuckle at times, very good slapstick comedy there. Sphinx's gameplay is fun and exciting. The world feels fleshed out, and I was surprised at how open some of the levels were and didn't expect side-quests. Not much in the way of 'collecting' incentives other than achievements.

The music is great too, but what this game is lacking is a voice cast. Everything is there ready - rich dialogue and facial animation... but speech is just a grunt from the speaker, then lots of reading for the player. Fortunately the game makes up for it several times over.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276370258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1620478576}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034306697', 'num_games_owned': 1401, 'num_reviews': 617, 'playtime_forever': 1175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1175, 'last_played': 1578319391}
review:
[b]A B-rated Zelda-like 3D platformer from 2003, ported to Steam in 2017.[/b]

Originally a console game, it was intended with a controller in mind. The controls for KB + M are actually fine for the most part, but in order to remap the keys you'll have to go within the files and do so manually, playing around and learning how to edit a .ini file.

There's not much of a story to the game, though what is interesting is that there are 2 protagonists; however, you're mainly using the first one you play as.
The first character's story just boils down to him happening to be the good guy who gets stuff done and is strong enough to beat the bad guys. Story NPC says they need something, hero gets thing and the NPC happens to have something important that progresses the journey as a reward.
The other character is very different; he's a prince who was killed off and comes back to life as a mummy to help out the first character through puzzle solving in a cartoon-y & slapstick manner.

The combat is very barebones when you're actually fighting; even the 4 boss fights aren't really anything too amazing either.

The pacing for the game isn't very good. 
The first part of the game takes an extremely long time before you have to fight the first boss of the game, which marks the end of the first chapter. Afterwards, it suddenly speeds up and before you know it you're already fighting the 3rd boss.

The puzzles are the highlight of the game and they're actually pretty good for the most part, at least in the sense that you just have to remember the tools available to you in order to get through something and have a memory for where particular objects are located. They're not difficult exactly, but it still feels nice when you solve something.
There are some secrets in this game, and what may constitute as a "secret" in a modern game is likely a required thing to find in this game in order to progress; in other words, being observant is just as important as puzzle solving.
Actual secret rewards, however, aren't really any more special than health upgrades.

The game seems to have just been ported to PC with only making it run on modern hardware properly in mind as a lot of features in the game are very outdated and limited. The only technical issues I've come across is a repeating music clip bug. 
It's a fun classic 3D platformer overall if you don't mind the dated-ness of some parts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042243158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1580683001}
review: I find this game to be very fun, being both relaxing and challenging in various parts. I love the various NPCs around the world and the setting. Makes me wish I found and played this game when it was originally released.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976502959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1578971792}
review:
Fun game with charming characters, and cheesy villains.  Reaching the 10 hour mark, I was surprised the game is a lot deeper than expected. I found myself enjoying both roles of Mummy and Sphinx, with the challenging - but not too hard - elemental based puzzles for the mummy, and more combat oriented gameplay of the Sphinx. Theres a little bit of everything here, platforming, hack n slash, puzzles, traps, finding keys to open a gate or door, opening treasure chests, catching your own monsters. I would say the only critique I have for it is that often time you may find yourself asking where to go next. The game gives little in the way of direction, but that may be more a reflection of myself. 

Overall, its a great game considering its age. If you enjoy games similar to Ratchet and Clank, Zelda, or even Crash Bandicoot, you will love this hidden gem buried beneath the dunes of other endless steam titles.

review:

Der Rätselanteil überwiegt dabei die Kämpfe. Die Grafik ist natürlich nicht mehr zeitgemäß, stört aber nicht. Speicherpunkte sind fair verteilt und stellen kein Problem dar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303081939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1679, 'last_played': 1690416010}
review:
I remember when this first came out on the Nintendo Gamecube, I was a child back then and I had a lot of fun playing this game. Looking back, I wondered how did I even beat this game? Don't get me wrong, this game is amazing, but some parts are so vague that it takes me a few hours to figure out. I can only remember some parts from the GC version, but not enough to get me through. 

Either way, I had a lot of fun playing this as a kid, and replaying is just as fun. I recommend this to anyone, give it a shot it's definitely worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000710694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1610074790}
review: One of the best Zelda-like adventure games of the Gamecube/PS2 era, Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy features a lot of fresh ideas. A colourful setting based on ancient Egyptian myths, fine character designs, wonderful music, simple yet effective puzzles, decent platforming and two charming protagonists with completely different playstyles help make this game a very unique trip. I'm just happy this got ported to PC so I can finally finish it after trying to clear this game for almost a decade, since my original Gamecube CD was damaged and froze at a certain point. Thank you, THQ, for bringing this back!

author: {'steamid': '76561198138695990', 'num_games_owned': 667, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1579333974}
review:
3인칭 게임에서 보기드문 fov조절 옵션이 존재한다는것 말고는 딱히 추천하고 싶지 않다.
카메라가 멋대로 움직이는거나 시점이 답답하다거나 움직임이 희한하다거나..
1990년대도 아니고 대가리에 총 맞지 않은 이상 제값주고 사지는 않을듯.

개인적으로 정말 싫어하는것중 하나가 게임 캐릭터가 벽을 등지고 서있을때 카메라가 캐릭터 등뒤로 돌아가지 않거나 카메라가 벽에 걸린듯한 느낌을 보여줄때, 굉장히!! 상당히!! 아주 극혐한다. 이 게임은 ps2시절에도 그랬던것 같지만 좁은 플랫폼에 서있는데 무리하게 카메라를 등뒤로 움직이다가 캐릭터가 난간 밖으로 밀려날수 있는 게임이다....개극혐.

조작때문에 빡치는 구간이 있을수 있으나 은근히 중독성이 있어서 개인적으로는 재미없는 게임은 아닌듯.
싸구려 버전 양키 감성 젤다의 전설 정도?? 젤다에 이런게임을 비빈다는것 자체가 큰 실례지만..
어쨋든 이거풀면 저게 꼬이고 저거 푸니 그게 꼬여서 여기저기 왔다갔다하는 게임.

머리회전이 빠르다거나 혹은 보통은 가는 사람들과 눈치가 있는 사람들에게 추천. 
그리고 공간지각능력도 가지고 있으면 좋음. 카메라가 멋대로 돌아버려서 사방에 뭐가 있는지 뒤에 뭐가 있었는지..
길치, 방향치는 그냥 갈 길 가심이.. 분명 패드 집어던지거나 키보드 샷건날림. ;p

분명히 하지만 캐릭도 바꿔가면서 플레이하고 재미도 있고 은근 중독성도 있다. 
특히 개인적으로는 모델링들이 은근 매력. 예전 일요일 아침 TV에서 보던 만화캐릭터들 느낌.
하지만 추천은 ㄴㄴ

author: {'steamid': '76561198801246836', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1544, 'last_played': 1625733468}
review: Game Smells Like a Good Fart!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987993888', 'num_games_owned': 2433, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 1204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1204, 'last_played': 1574189930}
review:
A good conversion of an underrated 3D Action Puzzle Platformer of yesteryear.

Sphinx plays somewhat like one of the N64 Zelda games, except with some precision platforming.
The developers of the port have increased the resolution of most of the textures in the game (there were two that were pretty blurry), so the game looks pretty nice. Of course the levels are pretty sparse since they were designed for more limited systems.
There is no voice acting in the game at all, not even Rare-style gibberish, so it is a fairly quiet game. The music is Egyptian-themed of course, but there isn't that much of it. What there is isn't grating or anything though, it's good enough that I didn't feel the need to plaster my ears shut.
Gameplay consists of some combat, some platforming and a fair bit of puzzle solving.
The first two parts (and indirectly the third) are hampered by what is every 3D platformer's greatest enemy: the camera.
If you're familiar with the N64's C-Stick camera in a lot of 3rd person games, it's similar in this game.
You can somewhat freely turn it around, but it will also often stop turning as if it's run into a wall.
And the game will often take control of it and change it, sometimes positioning it in the sky above you or facing you or wherever.
This can make combat and platforming more frustrating than it needs to be. 
In combat a lot of the enemies use some form of charge or jump move to avoid being hit and/or hitting you.
This makes the camera control very important to keep track of them, but as mentioned it's not great and won't always cooperate with the player. I did quite a lot of swinging my sword around blindly in the hopes of hitting something.
Platforming is already tricky since platforms often have some issue with their bounding box which makes the edges somewhat slippery and because jumping is somewhat influenced by momentum. Meaning you can jump further with a running start, although this is also a bit finicky.
Combine this with a camera that isn't great and you've got some frustrating jumps.

There are two playable characters with different play styles, which is interesting.
Sphinx has the more traditional action-based puzzle platforming sections, while the Mummy has more logic-based puzzle platforming sections. 
There are a lot of timed sections in the puzzles unfortunately (unless you like this obviously).
Especially in the Mummy's sections where he can acquire certain abilities for an amount of time which he loses when he acquires another ability or touches liquids.  I personally found this to lead to a quite a bit of frustration since I would have to reacquire said abilities often and this usually meant having to backtrack and watch an animation of him getting the ability over and over again.

The game relies on save points in order to save and these can often be spaced quite far apart. 
Usually you'll have to complete a whole puzzle platforming action section (say 15-30 minutes depending on how you do) before you can save. 

All in all, I enjoyed my time with Sphinx. I actually had a copy back in the day, but never finished it so I'm glad someone took the time to port it to PC.
I had fun with the two protagonists and their different play styles and the game is of a decent length.
So I would recommend it if you like 3D action puzzle platformers and can deal with the clunkiness of a game that was designed many years ago. It does end on a bit of a cliffhanger though and they never made any sequels as far as I'm aware.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984033886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3653, 'last_played': 1572654870}
review: I bought this game for nostalgic reasons, and I can say that I was pleasantly delighted to find that the game I knew and loved when I was younger playing this on my GameCube has been vastly improved on the PC. Sphinx is perhaps one of my favorite 3D platformers because of the colorful artwork and clever puzzle design. None of the characters have spoken dialogue, and yet they have a personality about them that I find to be quite charming. The story and game-play as a whole is very entertaining and I enjoyed my time with this title. 10/10 would recommend and play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025187473', 'num_games_owned': 688, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 1176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1176, 'last_played': 1573184630}
review:
Game has no problems running, all the bugs from the original console release have been fixed.
Not really much else to say, it's a typical action platformer from the 2000s, I've seen some people call it shovelware, but it's really not, it's a pretty good game and I would say worth it's price.

[h1]Some helpful tips[/h1]
[list]
[*]Stock up on frogs and armadillos when you can, you will need them
[*]Capture Beetles are controlled with the camera stick
[*]Enemies can be frozen and stood on
[*]Acid melts chains
[*]Talk to important NPCs multiple times to exhaust their dialogue
[*]You have to return four of the jewels to carry more than 400 scarabs
[*]Some enemies once defeated will not respawn
[*]Try to capture two of everything because there are two separate NPCs who want them
[*][u][b]When you enter the final area, there is no going back, not even after you beat the game, finish everything you want to before you go forwards[/b][/u]
[*][b]If you entered Uruk Castle Run without any bombs, there is a hidden ledge below the second destructible pillar at the end that spawns frogs[/b]
[/list]

With that said, enjoy the game, I had fun and I think you will too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194552965', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1682034567}

author: {'steamid': '76561198118644528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1573768431}
review:
I just found out about this game today, and it was an instant buy. The original game was absolutely amazing - graphically it wasn't awful, the animations and sound were great, and the gameplay was awesome. 
This here isn't just a port either. It's a full remaster - graphics are being brought into the modern era without ruining the original style. Even moreso, from what I understand the project is being undertaken by a single person. Nothing but props, and especially on sale this game could not be more worth it. It's an underground gem of a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146990557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1655066109}
review:
Very minor gripes - depth perception for forward jumps can be a little touchy (under and over-umps are regular occurrences) and the camera can be really tricky, especially in first person for the blowgun. Also, watch out for the ziplines - they don't behave like you would expect at all.

With that said, this was a PS2/Xbox/Gamecube gem back in college and I was pretty happy to get to finally finish it with some modern conveniences. Fun little game, worth my time at least.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262677125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1571220611}
review:
Uno dei tanti giochi di cui non sapevo nemmeno l'esistenza , almeno fino a poco tempo fà....
Ho scoperto il gioco durante i saldi e per curiosità ho deciso di  aggiungerlo in libreria , il fatto che fosse un gioco datato 2003 non mi ha scoraggiato dall' acquisto , anzi.....
Iniziando a giocarci ho notato subito che è un porting (presumo quindi fosse originariamente uscito su console)  del gioco originale , ma a parte qualche modifica per renderlo funzionante sui sistemi più moderni  e qualche ritocco grafico  , non è stato toccato altro . 
La difficoltà in alcuni livelli è abbastanza elevata , ma nulla che non sia impossibile. Ah dimenticavo è possibile salvare i progressi solo tramite dei checkpoint sparsi per i vari livelli (come nei primi Tomb Raider) , giusto per rendere le cose più interessanti.
 Bug per il momento non ne ho riscontrati , vedremo più avanti se uscirà fuori qualcosa.

Voto : 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198313928795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1526, 'last_played': 1582371450}
review:
A completely underrated game that I consider to be as good as Crash Bandicoot, Jak and Daxter, and The Legend of Zelda. Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy is an amazing game that deserves more praise and recognition.

Graphics: The graphics are colorful, vivid, and really charming. The game is more cartoon focused so don't expect realistic graphics. Plus, this game was originally for PS2, Gamecube and Xbox so it's an older title. Nevertheless, the visuals are beautiful. The amazing art inspired by ancient Egyptian civilization is a wonder to stare at.

Story: The story is amazing. Although there is no voice acting, much like Zelda games, the game tells a great story through dialogue. I won't spoil anything but everything is explained very well and it's all very interesting. The story has an amazing pace and is very original.

Gameplay: The gameplay is almost perfect. The combat is pretty smooth and the platforming is fun, easy and satisfying. Additionally, the puzzles are amazing and cleverly made. The game offers plenty to do with collectibles, mini games and entertaining sidequests. The only issue I had was the camera occasionally getting stuck at an angle that didn't let me see what I was doing. Also, enemies sometimes have ridiculous hit boxes that end up hurting or killing you when they really shouldn't have. But these are very small issues that don't affect the overall gameplay experience. I recommend a controller. 

Sound: The sounds are fantastic and the music is beautiful and memorable. I honestly was surprised by how much I loved the soundtrack. The sound and music fit the atmosphere of the game perfectly.

Verdict: 9.8

Truly an amazing  game. The visuals are fantastic, the sound/music is expertly crafted, the story is great and the gameplay is almost perfect. What a shame that this game didn't sell well back in its time, otherwise we would have had a sequel. Even after 25 hours of playing, I still wanted more. The full price is completely worth it. If you like Zelda, Mario or Crash Bandicoot, do yourself a favor and get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040604429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1570520103}

A great memory from my childhood. Got stuck on a hard lock via the save and quit glitch at some point of the game, and never finished. I finally got the chance to do so.

I recommend, it's a great classic, new mechanics are introduced almost constantly, an oldie, and a goddamn goodie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198380904117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 3560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3560, 'last_played': 1568520107}
review: I really liked this game.  You get to play as 2 characters, who have very different abilities, but are working towards the same goal.  There are several types of collectibles to earn/find and a variety of mini-games to beat.  The mini-games start out simple, but become more difficult as you go, which is perfect.  I never played the original, so I cannot compare the two, but the graphics were good enough for me.  The characters were likable and at times comedic.  Plus, the majority of dialogue can be skipped.  If you like old school adventure games then you should definitely try this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989234429', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1693349123}
review:
I have never seen such a glaring old school! Not only that, the game began to freeze at the tenth hour of the game. Like a pirate disc. What I managed to overcome. But I managed for the second time to accidentally click on a new game, instead of LOAD. Why did the save  with progress.
He just sat down more comfortably in an armchair, relaxed, reached for a cup of tea and looked, the game started from the very beginning ... Thanks to the convenient console menu from the late 90s.
And so, the game is wonderful. I wanted to write a nostalgic review, but it won’t work out.
developer_response:
Hi, luckily the game does constant backups for cases just like this.

To recover/roll back your save slot you can follow the instructions here. It's just a matter of renaming files: https://steamcommunity.com/app/606710/discussions/0/3658515990045307593/#c3658515990051021250

Providing more information about the freeze via Steam Community forums or Discord would be helpful, we have generally solved most of the issues people have come up with.

Sorry about that, let me know if that helps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116159883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1560751774}

author: {'steamid': '76561198120448985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1564447564}
review:
So I usually try to write up long details about why I do or don't recommend games, but I'll make Sphinx one of those exceptions.

+The concept and world is wholly unique
+The type of game-play in Sphinx is probably the closest we'll ever get to having a perfect Zelda adventure that isn't Zelda
+The mummy segments were really fun puzzle dungeons
+Graphics were top notch and still look great despite being around 15+ years old
+A lot of the faults you'll have with this game are due to it being earlier in the 6th generation of consoles

But there are minor faults

-This game isn't super polished (I heard it was worse when it was first ported to Steam); it's probably about 80% of the way there.  I'm speaking particularly about the platforming, because it needs tweaking
-The story could've been more compelling and interesting
-Sphinx NEVER changes that weird grin on his face the entire game
-There are audio issues and on top of that the music wasn't much to write home about
-The world is great, but the magic of Egyptian landscapes and ancient temples does wear off; a little more variety in atmosphere would've gone a long way, because most of the game feels very samey
-The combat is really bad and I just never got why the game is littered with so many pointless enemy encounters

Despite these complaints I highly recommend Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy; it's fun, and has some incredibly interesting game design that makes it stand apart from any other game.  I REALLY hope Sphinx get's a revival via a sequel - I think that now having somewhat of a cult-status following, making a second installment with improvements would have great sales if done right.  THQ, PLEASE MAKE A SEQUEL TO SPHINX!!!

(Shout out to Nitro Rad for reviewing and recommending this game to me!  Go subscribe to his YouTube Channel!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198261957551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1563498278}
review:
I wouldn't say this game is trash, per se, but it feels like Jak and Daxter if the devs turned around and did everything wrong. 

* Sphinx feels slow and unsatisfying to move and control (the game's framerate is fine; he just moves at a turtle's pace)
* Jak is snappy, moves fast and is satisfying to control.

* Sphinx's combat feels equally sluggish. You spend the first 20-30 minutes of the game laboriously throwing fucking rocks. C'mon!
* Jak's combat feels nice and is, once again, snappy, as it implements a simple melee fighting system with interesting enemies. Oh, and there's the eco, too. Different eco gives you different powerups.

* Sphinx's tutorial stage is just awful. I haven't been this bored by a tutorial since Runescape.
* Jak and Daxter starts you out in an interesting area that swiftly teaches you the mechanics of the game without being overbearing.

* The enemies are boring. The first couple enemies consist of exploding flowers, exploding frogs, eyeballs on sticks that lock the gates if they see you (trust me, it's not as cool as it sounds), and spiders. 
* Jak and Daxter has Lurkers. They're like a whole civilization of varied purple animal people with their own rudimentary technology. <3 lurkers.

* Sphinx implements game overs and will literally take you back all the way to the save point (or beginning of game) upon death. Not only are the save points few and far between, but the game doesn't even telegraph this fact correctly, because you can fall into death pits or lava and go back to a checkpoint just like in Jak and Daxter. But if you take too much damage, for some stupid reason, you get to *slowly* sit through a game over screen, and have a shit load of progress sucked away. This is not good design.
* Jak and Daxter (and all of the later games in its franchise) does not implement game over. If you die, whether by taking too much damage, by falling to your death, getting scorched by lava, blown up, falling in a pit of dark eco, etc, you will respawn at the last check point.. You will never randomly "die for real" and get sent back to a save point, as there are no save points in J&D.

The deal breaker is definitely the slow everything. Slow gameplay is boring gameplay. Fast, tight or self-paced (e.g. turn-based combat) gameplay is always better.

You can't say that I've never played and enjoyed 3D retro platformers, because J&D, a game that is simply better in every respect, came out in 2002, a year before this game.

Eurocom, take some notes from Naughty Dog, please.

--

So would I recommend this game? Absolutely not. In fact, fuck it, this is now a review for Jak and Daxter.

Jak and Daxter is an amazing and quirky 3D platformer lite-collect-a-thon game where you play as Jak. During a trek in a forbidden zone, Jak and Daxter run into some baddies and Daxter falls into a pit of dark eco, turning him into a furry little otter/weasel hybrid dubbed an 'ottsel'. Daxter gets over it pretty quickly, but they get reprimanded by the sage of green eco, and embark on a quest to turn Daxter back to his human form. During their quest, they run into lots of charming and quirky characters who offer rewards in return for favors in a charming fantasy world.

10/10 Jak and Daxter is bae.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279191826', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1656382107}

author: {'steamid': '76561198157258840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1563713341}
review:
Il s'agit d'un vieux jeu PS2 comme nous le montre ces graphismes, ce n'est pas un chef d'oeuvre mais il est bon...

Les musiques sont sympas, les décors sont cool, l'histoire à l'air sympa à première vue bien que classique.

Bien sur il y a des défauts, la caméra se bloque assez fréquemment, ce qui vous empêche de voir autour de vous, je suis mort une fois comme ca à cause des ennemis explosifs que je n'ai pas vu...
Il y a aussi les sauts, attention, ils ne sont pas mal gérés mais c'est vrai qu'on a souvent l'impression que le perso ne saute pas assez haut ou pas assez loin, ce n'est que mon ressenti mais j'hésite souvent devant un trou, à me placer presque au pixel près pour être sur d'avoir la corniche en face...

Mais bref, malgré cela, c'est un bon jeu d'action-aventure-puzzle que je vous recommende.

ATTENTION !!! 
Il y a tout de même quelque chose que je me dois de préciser avant que vous ne l'achetiez. Branchez une manette sur votre PC, le jeu n'a pas de config de touches clavier et passer du AZERTY au QWERTY est impossible même via le raccourci Alt-Maj.
Jouer au clavier n'est pas impossible mais ca va rendre votre expérience beaucoup plus compliqué...

author: {'steamid': '76561198057984637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1694967695}
review:
One of the better ports you'll find of an older console game. Thanks to a bevy of visual upgrades and careful engine rewrites, we're left with something more stable than a good number of triple-A ports in recent years. 

The game itself is split between Zelda-esque Sphinx sections and the more puzzle-oriented Mummy sections, switching back and forth as the story demands. Thankfully the majority of puzzles are environmental or timing-based, with block pushing kept to a minimum. There isn't any sort of lock-on for combat in this game, so they compensated by giving Sphinx massive, over-exaggerated swings. It works pretty well and feels similar to using the wrench against trash mobs in a Ratchet game or something.
Overall it's [i]way[/i] better than it was ever given credit for. I remember walking into a Gamestop back in the day and seeing 10 copies in the bargain bin. That was over 10 years ago, and it's only just recently started to receive attention. You'd think this was Anubis II or something. 

Two big visual highlights are probably the animations and environments. The environments have really cool color palettes (which range from soothing purples to bright yellow) and are absolutely massive in scale which, unfortunately, also means frequent loading zones (though this isn't much of an issue on modern PCs). The animations just stood out to me as really fluid and detailed for the era.

A few complaints would be that the menus are somewhat barebones and there isn't an easy way to rebind your controls ingame, as well as the fact that a few visual effects from the PS2 version are still missing since they used very specific hardware tricks to pull them off (though the developer's working to add them back in). IIRC that's also the reason why they weren't in the XBox release, which is the version this port is based off of.

Overall, a must-have for any fan of pre-open-world action adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198183870106', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1546569899}

author: {'steamid': '76561197989923801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 3125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2122, 'last_played': 1612809665}
review:
Отличное переиздание прекрасного приключения!
Эту игру трудно отнести к какому-то одному жанру. Главное здесь - именно приключение:
игра делится на чередующиеся главы то за "незадачливого" фараона, то за Сфинкса (еще не бога, но уже отличного воина).
Захватывающе. Сфинкс управляется с мечом, стреляет и даже иногда "покемонит" монстров. Фараон же, попавший под неприятное проклятие, может бегать да прятаться (что очень здорово и немного платформено реализовано).
Мир забавный, смешной, наполненный атмосферными жителями и монстрами.
О переиздании - отличная работа! Разрешения, подтянутая графика, удобная раскладка для клавы.
"Сфинкса" даже не хочется ни с чем сравнивать - просто попробуйте! Что-то такое из детства, веселое и очаровательное.

author: {'steamid': '76561198285024780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1846, 'last_played': 1591709698}

author: {'steamid': '76561198111069234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1519530304}
review: A wonderful Adventure game from the early 2000's that has finaly been ported to PC. The game takes place in a Fantasy world based off Ancient Egypt and the mythologies surroding it. Though the graphics have not been remastererd they still are enjoyable for a 3d game from about 15 years ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144340281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1575159719}
review: Played this game when i was a child on the PS2, but never made it passed the first time you play as the mummy. Saw it was on steam and wanted to give it a try now that i'm older and more experienced in video games and 3D adventure puzzle games. BEST purchase I've made in a long time. As soon as i launched the game i was taken back to my youth and was dazzled by the intro music and all the effects. Can't tell you how many hours i spent just leaving my PS2 on to listen to the music and pretend i was an ancient Egyptian action hero fighting mummies. The game itself is amazing and runs super well. The controls took me a couple mins to get used to, but once you get it down or if you play with a controller it's great. If you have any interest in Egyptian mythology, puzzle games, 3D adventure games, or just think the game looks cool then i highly recommend you buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043490435', 'num_games_owned': 506, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1557529882}
review:
I had this game for the Gamecube way back when, and it felt a lot longer back then. I ran into several game-breaking bugs back then, including one that prevented me from beating the game at the last area in the game, to which I ended up crying into the game manual and never played again. 
I'm glad this game was brought back to Steam and revamped it, in a way. A nice new retexturing, the bugs have all been fixed, however this game is not as good as I remember.
The combat is very repetitive and the game has an outdated game development. By that I mean, this game was developed in a time where checkpoints were not commonplace and neither was fast travel. There is some backtracking that comes with this practice, unfortunately. 
Besides that, the boss fights are where the game drops off a bit. They're repetitive, sometimes frustrating, sometimes boring, fights that aren't really all that satisfying. There's only a small handful, 3 I think, so it's not too bad. Just make sure you saved beforehand. 
However, the game has a lot of personality and soul to it. The npcs are charming, as are the enemies. The game looks and feels like there was a lot of effort put into it, the only thing it's missing is quality-of-life tweaks. It's just one of those games developed in a strange time for games, I guess. However, that's okay by me. There are a lot of little things to do, challenges to complete, things to collect, etc. 
Like I said previously, I really appreciate the effort that went into restoring the game into a more playable and better looking experience. I'm happier to have completed the game after all these years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067645576', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1686513438}

author: {'steamid': '76561198176628993', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1688783821}
review:
Eu comprei o jogo só pra matar a saudade do PS2 kk  O jogo é incrível
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Prós:
Trilha sonora ma-ra-vi-lho-sa    
História pra lá de engraçada e complexa
Dentro do jogo você vai conhecendo outros NPC's e outras histórias e ajudando essas pessoas.
Você coleciona itens dentro do jogo
Você adquire poderes especiais
As fases são complexas
O mundo é gigante 
Existem diversas SUBmissões que vc pode fazer ao longo do game sem interferir na missão principal
Tem um sistema de escolhas (não sei se interfere no final)
Gráficos ótimos
Desafios de NPC's
Capacidade de evoluir suas habilidades
E o mais legal, o jogo não é facin, tipo aqueles que mostra na telinha oque vc tem que fazer kk vc tem que ler, interpretar e tirar as conclusões do que deve ser feito (o tamanho do mapa e dos mundos da um toque a mais na dificuldade).
Contras: Não tem continuidade pra um segundo jogo ;-;

author: {'steamid': '76561198061604287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1665295202}
review:
TL;DR: Absolutely Buy This

THE GOOD: Seems like a bit of a Zelda clone on the surface, and definitely took influence from it's world stucture/puzzles. However, if it is a Zelda clone, it's by far the best one. The overworld is small but extremely memorable, and constantly expanding as the character gains new abilities. The puzzles, specifically the mummy levels, are awesome and the platforming as Sphinx feels smoother than any zelda game I've played. The actual moveset given to sphinx is fairly limited, but the variety of enemies mixed with their unique attacks and weaknesses makes fights feel very engaging in harder segments. The music is suberb, the artstyle is beautiful and the game looks great to me even today. It's a game you can tell the developers were passionate about, and for them to release a port of this quality for long time fans is a beautiful thing.

The Bad: There are no keybind options in the menu, remapping the keyboard is extremely hard to do. The default controls aren't unusable but could definitely be better. Uncapped frame rate seems to cause slight physics issues (Gauntlet 3 is practically impossible). Save points act as checkpoints, and are very poorly placed. There is a fair amount of VSYNC but not unplayable. Unksippable cutscenes. No voice acting (Personal Preferences)

Anything bad about this game is extremely minor in my opinion.

PS: I also commend the devs for their continued support in the community and for getting this game on PC.
developer_response: Quick note: Cutscenes can be skipped on PC by pressing the inventory button.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995682047', 'num_games_owned': 955, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1193, 'last_played': 1554217610}
review:
Zelda-Killer?
Damals wurde das Spiel als Zelda-Killer beworben. Ich bin großer Zelda-Fan. Trotzdem habe ich bis heute "Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy" nie gespielt. Gut, dass ich dies jetzt auf dem PC nachholen durfte. 
Ein toller Port solange man mit dem Controller spielt! 21:9 Auflösungen werden ebenfalls unterstützt.
Es dauert zwar etwas bis das Spiel in Gang kommt, aber nach 2 Stunden hatte ich die ersten Aha-Momente. Tolles Rätseldesign und gute Spielmechaniken. Teilweise ist das Spiel auch gar nicht mal so leicht.
Leider reicht es vom Umfang und der Komplexität nicht an ein Zelda heran.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015223987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2023, 'last_played': 1553126628}
review:
Uma jornada épica, divertida e envolvente para quem curte cultura egípcia e jogos de aventura. Com um mundo muito bem construído, cheio de mistérios, side quests e itens para encontrar, é fácil querer gastar várias horas explorando cada canto dos diversos cenários e interagindo com os personagens para conhecer suas histórias. 

Recomendo! 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198122713949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2604, 'last_played': 1543451586}
review:
My all-time favourite game! Absolutely stunning game world and atmosphere, fun gameplay and an epic story based loosely on Egyptian mythology. I've played through Sphinx countless times and will always go back to it. It has a real enchanting charm to it that captivated me from the moment I first played it on PS2 after it caught my interest in a bargain bin. This game never got the success and limelight it deserved, so I'm pleased to have it on Steam and recommend it to anyone up for an adventure full of action, platforming, puzzle solving and monster collecting.

I salute THQ Nordic for reviving this forgotten gem, and the developer Swyter for his hard work on this port and his continued efforts to answer queries and make regular updates to improve the game. I also recommend purchasing the authoring tools for an insight into the game's development, along with the amazing soundtrack. My only gripe about the game itself is the way that it ends, because it suggests there would be a sequel which we never got. Please make another Sphinx game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970815119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1552808361}
review:
Buy it if you like classical action platforming game play, it's worth your time.
This game is just so charming, the devs obviously took a lot of effort creating all the characters in the game.
Each of them just oozes personality and animate great.
The outside environments are a bit sparse, but that's what you get wit remastered older games of course.

Switching the characters between the more versatile hero Sphinx to the lovable, limited but indestructible mummy Tut was a great idea.

Man this should have been a cartoon, a comic or a cgi motion picture.
I wish there was an art book.

author: {'steamid': '76561198360079692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1551306253}
review: A little gem of a game that I have never beaten as a child and decided to pick it up for the sake of doing what little ol me couldn't. I'm not necessarily blinded by nostalgia despite having hours of time on it when I was younger (don't ask how I didn't beat it in that time) and I can honestly say it's a decent game. It's totally not a wow blow your pants off game but it's a nice distraction and it just works and only downside is some aspects such as using items could've been streamlined. Music is nice all around especially whenever the tunes for the mummy whenever he's influenced by the elements is such a nice touch and playfulness. Gameplay is pretty much your standard PS2 era platformer which isn't all too bad except sword combat is a little dull however the game's puzzles are the bread and butter which most of them are pretty nice not too difficult not too easy just the right amount of time and effort. All bosses sadly are terrible, they are a test of patience in a very bad way with certain gimmicks or aspects taking too long such as being slowly chased down by the boss wait for specific attack that will give you an opening but oh wait the bone minions killed that opening and now you have to transform into a frog again and repeat and that's only waiting a minute or two of literally walking around a room in a circle for that frog transformation to happen. Almost all bosses are pretty much circle around boss. Final boss is kinda like that but it had some hazards to make it not as easy so I'll give it a slide. Overall, we need more games like these without having a millions upon millions dollar budget with the risk of needing to break even and then some. Nice little fill in games with enough polish and unique fun to be had without needing to push industry standard and without being a rehash clone of game x, y or z with a small tweak. If you like old PS2 games just grab it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130757809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1527138143}
review: This game is an absolute childhood favorite. While i was never able to get to the end (due to young me being unable to figure out the King tut puzzles), this game has held such a special place in my heart. and over 15 years later there has yet to be another game like it! Whether you are a returning nostalgic player or brand new to Sphinx i would definitely recommend trying it out. I think its fantastic that someone decided to port it over to PC. I purchased it as soon as i saw it on the first day it was released. The gameplay is good and fun. there are unique features that still hold up to this day. The soundtrack is awesome (maybe thats more nostalgia for me). The sphinx gameplay is largely different from the tut gameplay which really helps add variety to the game. The graphics still hold up too (in a nintendo sort of way).. But even better, the awesome group who ported the game over are also restoring the game and modernizing it. They have slowly been implementing fixes for bugs even from the original console version, they are updating and adding in new textures to make the game feel younger than it really is, and they are attempting to create a workshop section so other players can mod and create their own content. I HIGHLY  recommend this for anybody! Full price!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062121070', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2058, 'last_played': 1550349476}
review:
I remember playing this game on PS2 and fell in love with it then. I thought it was one of the best games I had played ever!

Then I never bought another console till date and dropped the idea of buying them because the PlayStation consoles were not backwards compatible (extremely disappointing).

I had been wishing this game for a long time to come to pc. One day, I saw this on steam and I was baffled (pleasantly).

I would have been happy even with the old game but never thought I would see a remaster as THQ & Eurocom were defunct.

Now, coming to the game, I only played for a while and I am pleased to say that I still love the game. The textures are really nice. The game works smoothly on my FX 6300 & Nvidia 760.

The game recommends a controller (rightly so) but the game is playable with the keyboard as well.

WSAD for direction. Tab to Interact. Esc to crawl. F for the fight. Spacebar to jump. Direction keys for selecting various items.

Overall, highly recommend to fans & New to the series. The game is a Platformer + Zelda type puzzle solving game. Music is fabulous and suits the theme of the game amazingly.

PS: Just finished the game 100% achievements using Keyboard + Mouse. Had tremendous fun playing it again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198091462939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1549209391}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025185898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 1774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1774, 'last_played': 1548571653}
review:
I loved this game back in 2003, and I love it now.  A fun platformer.

However- an otherwise good experience was marred with control issues. It is not optomised for keyboard/mouse control so I recommend playing with a controller. And even then, I found the response time lacking in certain parts, particularly dungeons requiring lots of keysmash. (The flying parts, to make it as nonspoilery as possible but really, this game is old enough to get a job)

Also the age of the game is evident in that you can only save at certain spots- usually at the start of each segment. This mean should you run into a glitch or simply die, You have to start All. Over. Again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045744747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1601157164}
review:
Originally I gave this game a pretty harsh review because of a game-breaking glitch, but the developers have worked really well to polish this game for the PC. This puzzle-platformer based on Egyptian mythology was sadly quite underrated in its time. It is a tip of the hat to the 3D era of the Legend of Zelda series, but with a really neat variety of mechanics that totally differ whether you are playing as Sphinx or as the mummy.

The PC version gives this classic game a much needed resolution upgrade, and I would say does its PS2/Gamecube predecessor much justice.

The Platformer is my favorite game genre, and this particular game is one I wish I would have known about back in 2003 when it originally came out.
developer_response: The upcoming update should finally fix this weird issue. Sorry about that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043329060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1547676987}
review:
[h1]How does it run?[/h1]
This version of the game runs buttery smooth and they also fixed a huge game-breaking bug that was present on the console versions. I only encountered 2 glitches in my playthrough both of which were fixed with a loading screen.

[h1]Short Review[/h1]
This a great platformer that focuses mostly on puzzles and has a bit of combat. There are some annoying features like the lack of checkpoints and the unnecessarily large overworld, but it is otherwise an enjoyable and simple game with an Egyptian theme. So if you like platformers and Egypt give this one a try.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1] 
Although this is a platformer you don't really do that much platforming in this game, instead you will spend most of your time, solving puzzles. You take control of 2 characters, Sphinx and Tut. Sphinx plays similarly to a Zelda game, meaning you will have some basic combat and platforming and a lot of dungeons that use one specific mechanic to solve them. That is one problem of the game however, since the abilities you get are almost never put to use after getting through their dungeon. A great example is the bouncing darts which you have to use only once in the entire game.

The second character you play as is Tut the mummy. His gameplay is based entirely on puzzle solving but his puzzles have a nice twist. Since he is already technically dead he can't die agaub, so you can set him on fire, electrocute him etc. in order to solve puzzles. The game can get creative with it and his puzzles are very interesting. I do wish they had some really challenging puzzles considering how many interesting things you can do with the mechanics but alas the puzzles are overall kept simple.

[h1]Presentation[/h1]
Considering the game came out in 2003 it looks absolutely incredible. The character models, in particular, are very well made with some crisp textures. Since the game takes place entirely in Egypt I thought it would get boring with similar environments, but the artists did a great job of differentiating every area and keeping it interesting. The soundtrack is nothing mind-blowing but it was fitting and enjoyable to listen, I do wish however that the game had some voiceover because the characters do talk a lot but it is just text. Because of that everyone is really animated which gives the game a lot of personality.

[h1] Conclusion[/h1]
In the end, I definitely recommend this game to people that love puzzle-platformers for sure. I do have to warn you though the game has a very lackluster ending with a huge cliffhanger that never got resolved since the game didn't sell all that well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043216780', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1689192580}

author: {'steamid': '76561197974928204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1677543768}
review:
Launched during the same holiday season as several massive 3D platformer games in 2003, Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy simply got lost in the onslaught. This was incredibly saddening, because this game is utterly brilliant, from beginning to end. It can be very challenging at times, but that is what most of us looks for in a game to begin with, but not unfairly so. The graphics were fantastic, and the soundtrack is one of the better soundtracks of that generation of games IMO. Nobody was happier than I, when I found out this game was going to launch on Steam, better late than never in this case for sure. 

If you enjoy 3D platformers, like Jak and Daxter, Ratchet and Clank, Mario, etc... then do yourself a favor and purchase this gem. Full price, sale price, doesn't matter, this game is worth every penny no matter what the price of admission. I know it indicates that I don't have many hours invested, well, that is simply due to my massive backlog I am currently trying to cut down, on top of the fact that I have beaten the game on every other platform it was released on, PS2, Xbox, Gamecube/Wii, but I assure you I have hundreds of hours invested in this game world, and am looking forward to the day, soon I hope, when I can revisit it now on my new PC!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046096481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1548462837}
review:
I love this game, I played the XBOX port as a kid and I'm incredibly happy to see an HD PC port of this game! I would definitely reccomend it to people who've played 3D style Zelda games.
Unfortunately there's some minor flaws with this port which I'd be very happy to see a fix for sometime!
Some issues I've run into are:
- Infrequent game stutters
- Sphinx/Tut movement sound effects not constantly playing (Especially when you're hanging off a ledge and moving left/right)
- Background music disappearing
- Background music overlapping with other background music
These glitches don't happen all the time but it's enough to be noticable.
