author: {'steamid': '76561198022413675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 1670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1488, 'last_played': 1544966959}
review:
Escribo esta reseña mientras me deleito con la magnífica banda sonora original del juego, y es que por fortuna para los jugadores de PC, hemos podido disfrutar de este juego que pasó desapercibido en su momento en PS2 y Gamecube.

No es que abunden los juegos inspirados en el Antiguo Egipto, más allá de las excavaciones de Lara Croft, Pharaon y quizás uno de los últimos Assassin´s Creed, así que el momento histórico y ambientación ya es un punto a favor en el juego. La historia gira en torno a la eterna lucha entre el bien y el mal, algo recurrente, y que se desarrolla desde tiempos inmemoriales y parece seguirá hasta el final de los tiempos; en este caso el bien encarnado por Osiris, y el mal encarnado por Set, el juego nos pone en la piel de Sphinx (y Tuthankamon, del que luego hablaré), un aprendiz de Imhotep que debe ayudar a Annubis y convertirse en el elegido de la profecía de Ra, y así salvar el mundo. Típico argumento de elegidos, con los dioses y algunos faraones egipcios como actores secundarios. 

Estamos ante un juego de plataformas, por lo que se hace imprescindible el uso del mando para mejorar sensiblemente la experiencia de juego, una vez adaptado, las teclas son fáciles de asimilar, pues no hay demasaiada complejidad. Aunque los comienzos del juego pueden resultar desoladores pues no podremos hacer gran cosa y será lineal, cuando salimos de la especie de tutorial el juego comenzará a mostrar su potencial, con tres grandes zonas a explorar y dentro de estas sus llamémoslas "mazmorras", en este sentido recuerda bastante a la saga Zelda, tanto por el sistema de manejo como por la forma de interactuar a través de los escenarios. La ambientación es agradable a la vista, con bonitos templos antiguos, una ciudad, playas, parcos en detalles eso sí, pero lo compensa con el buen rendimiento que ofrece y la interesante paleta de colores elegida.

A medida que avancemos, se nos abrirán nuevas posibilidades, ya sea realizando quest secundarias, buscando secretos por los escenarios, o realizando pruebas de habilidad, entre otras, cada logro nos otorgará mejoras en nuestra salud, inventario, nuevas habilidades, acceso a nuevas zonas; si estáis acostumbrados a este tipo de juegos todo os resultará bastante familiar en su desarrollo. Aquí nos vamos moviendo por el escenario abierto, y cuando nos asignen una misión, se nos abrirá alguna mazmorra, llena de enemigos pintorescos, y obstáculos a superar; hay mucho plataformeo en el juego, sin llegar a niveles de frustración absurdos, algunas se nos pueden atascar más que otras, sobretodo si hay tiempo de por medio, los puzzles poseen cierta complejidad en su desarrollo, y no suele ser obvia la solución hasta haber explorado a conciencia los escenarios. En cuanto a los citados enemigos, son animales equipados con armamento de diversos tipos, originales, aunque fáciles de superar y escasos. También existen varios jefes finales, igualmente sencillos de vencer. Contamos tan solo con una espada y nuestra habilidad para superarlos...suficiente. Los personajes secundarios tampoco aportan gran cosa, están por exigencias del guión, debes ayudarlos para continuar la historia o para que te den objetos, o incluso comprar equipamiento.

La otra parte del juego es El Castillo de Uruk, donde manejaremos a Tuthankamón, una momia que debe recuperar su esencia vital poco a poco; son las partes más divertidas y delirantes del juego, pues no puede morir, así que puede chamuscarse para quemar madera que impida el paso, electrificarse para llevar corriente o dividirse para trabajar en equipo, aquí son los puzzles los que deberemos resolver, apartados de la lucha de Sphinx, y utilizando el sigilo para pasar desapercibido de algunos enemigos. Son fases bastante divertidas a la par que frustrantes en ocasiones, hay que tener muy claro el paso siguiente pues si vamos a ciegas no sabremos que hacer: exploración a conciencia del escenario, buscar todos los elementos con los que poder interactuar y pensar con lógica.

Las pruebas de habilidad son divertidas de realizar, todas con tiempo cronometrado, pruebas de memoria, acertar con la cerbatana, pruebas de velocidad, habilidad, todas con la lógica recompensa al conseguirlas. En el menú podremos ver en todo momento los objetos de la misión, los trofeos conseguidos, los monstruos capturados (sí, tiene ciertos momentos Pokemon el juego, imprescindibles para avanzar), o las misiones asignadas. Correctos en este sentido, sin destacar.

En cuanto a nivel sonoro, los sonidos son parcos y normalitos, no existen voces en el juego, tan solo leves quejidos y gruñidos animales. Lo que sí es de elogiar es su banda sonora, todas con claras melodías inspiradas en el Antiguo Egipto, con sus estilos propios; a veces existen ciertos problemas o conflictos con el sonido, puede dejar de escucharse la música o entrecortarse, basta con reiniciar el juego. 

En definitiva, muy buen juego de plataformas, bastante adictivo, aunque pueda parecer algo desfasado lo compnesa con algunos puzzles interesantes y buen ritmo general del juego, nunca cansa y el hecho de jugar con dos personajes muy diferentes le aporta variedad, aderezándolo con una gran banda sonora.

NOTA 8´5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198387753879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1543495446}
review:
Ich fand das Spiel schon damals toll, als ich es noch auf dem Gamecube gezockt hatte, auch wenn die Grafik nicht die Schönste war. Jetzt als Pc Version mit überarbeiterte Grafik macht es sogar noch mehr Spaß.
Die Charaktere sind schön gestaltet. Ich habe da einige Lieblingscharaktere, aber am meisten gefällt mir das Aussehen von Sphinx und der Humor von Tut.
Die Rätsel im Game sind auch relativ einfach, wenn man weiß wie es geht und das Kampfsystem ist auch für diese Zeit schon gut ausgearbeitet. Das Spiel würde ich jedem Zeldafan empfehlen, da es sichs dabei um das selbe Studio handelte und viele Gameplayelemente damit verbindet.
Aber auch Leute die allgemein Lust auf solche Art von Spielen hat.
Allerdings ist es recht schade dass es keinen zweiten Teil gab, denn das Ende war leider ziemlich offen.
Für mich einfach ein recht gelungendes Game was definitiv einen weiteren Teil verdienen würde.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024039846', 'num_games_owned': 1760, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1542576439}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078577836', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1613, 'last_played': 1659412169}
review:
If you like traditional-style 3D Zelda you'll probably like this one since it has quite a bit of stuff that we've come to expect in a Zelda game, like:

- No voice acting.
- You earn money by breaking pots.
- There is a heart piece equivalent (Y'know how it works, earn 4 to increase your health)
- Shop minigames
- Dungeons (Action-focused when playing as Sphinx, puzzle-focused when playing as the Mummy, both have 3D platforming mixed in as well)


The only complaint I have is that it's not as lengthy as a Zelda game, but it's understandable as it was actually rushed when it originally came out, much like what happened with Wind Waker. 

Unlike Wind Waker though, there is quite a bit of cut content still present in the game files, and some fans are already working on restoring that content into the game, so I'm sure it'll be worth a replay in the future to experience the extra stuff.

And finally, I have a tip for everyone who's looking to play this, which is to save as often as possible, especially before and after bosses. You'll thank me later.

author: {'steamid': '76561198235138052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1526329176}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043709382', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2367, 'last_played': 1539070650}
review:
Overall this was a good game. It's aged well but is still dated

Pros
Decent grapics considering when it came out
Excellent puzzle solving, reminds me of Zelda
Decent amount of content for completionists
Good soundtrack overall

Cons
Occasionally has bugs that force restart (i5-6600k at 3.9, GTX 1070)
Fairly short in a casual run ~14 hours
Requires backtracking several times but has semi-fast travel options through cheap boat rides
No final boss theme, it's shared with other bosses.

Overal, I'd give it a solid 7.5/10, adjusting for it's age. It is very much a Zelda clone, but great all the same.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184663587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1546194951}

author: {'steamid': '76561198141640159', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1255, 'last_played': 1700721591}
review:
Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy is one of, if not, my absolute favorite games of all time.

I grew up with this game and played originally on the GameCube, "borrowing" my Mother's saves whenever she passed an area that I wasn't able to complete and continuing from there. I still remember the first time I managed to take down Set. I was so happy and proud of my accomplishment I actually stayed on the final dialogue in order to show my Mother that I had finally beaten one of my video game experiences ever! My first playthrough wasn't the most complete or "honest" but I still enjoyed the game and went back for another round shortly after. 

The game has two different protagonists that play very differently from one another. You have Sphinx, the double-jumping, sword-swinging, kick-ass superhero you've always looked up to. Then you have the Mummy, a clumsy, dopey, ridiculous dork of a main character that I've ever laid eyes onto and played, but I love him to death. Both of their segments are very well done and decently separate from one another, so you really don't get tired of playing one or the other for too long. 

Sphinx is who you will spend a vast majority of your time playing, and he is an absolute joy to play. As you collect more and more abilities and become stronger and stronger he just becomes such a fun character to slay enemies left and right with. You can feel the true power from his swings and the impact of the blade with every strike, you truly feel like a hero in Sphinx's shoes (or feet, rather).

The Mummy is the secondary character who still play a major role in helping Sphinx progress and become more powerful at the same time. Being dead, the Mummy can use a vast variety of abilities to solve the many puzzles he stumbles into. Light yourself ablaze to burn down that pesky wooden gate that stands in your way. In need of a spark? No problem! The Mummy can carry an electric charge to wherever he finds himself needing power. Is that gap in the wall a tad too small to fit into? No sweat! Just get yourself smooshed and the Mummy will fit right in and grab that final key to finish the puzzle you've been stuck on. 

Switching between the two is very enjoyable and gives you a bit of a break from one another in order to keep you entertained. You've got your action segments with Sphinx where you can hack and slash your way through tons of enemies and rescue that damsel in distress. While the Mummy gets the gears in your brain turning and forces you to find a solution where there appears to be none. It's this back and forth gameplay that I find so appealing to this game and wish more games nowadays would use to their advantage. 

While I adore this game to death, no game is truly without flaw. This game suffers similar issues from the Legend of Zelda series. At times, you will grab a new item in a dungeon and only use it for that specific dungeon (looking at you bouncing darts). Granted, this is a small problem with very few items, but it still exists and shouldn't be overlooked, Other than that, the original release versions of the game suffered from glitches and major problems that would make the game harder or actually unbeatable. These have thankfully been fixed and aren't even something to worry about in this release. (thank you Swyter!) But the lack of using some of your items after their introductions doesn't go unnoticed. 

Some of the lower points aside, this game overall is a fantastic experience that I will 110% say you indulge into and go through for yourself. The gameplay is amazing and still holds up after all of these years. It's an astounding looking game, even for the time of its initial release. The music is award worthy, earning spots in my head for songs I can never get rid of. and the environments are beautifully and painstaking crafted to cause your jaw to drop when you remember that this game released originally in 2003. 

Overall, this game still holds up today and I would even argue is better than a lot of the AAA titles we see drop yearly. If you have the money (which is totally a steal of what I think this game is worth) and the time to sit down and truly experience this masterpiece for what it is, I highly, HIGHLY advise you grab this one. This is THE hidden gems of hidden gems. There's a reason that I will always remember this game as one of my absolute favorites. 

I may be biased, I may be blinded by nostalgia, but, I love this game and I'm sure you will, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064266037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1013, 'last_played': 1563164547}

author: {'steamid': '76561198434432222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1536039174}
review:
Payed dear money for this game because I liked a lot back in the days. And it is [b]NOT[/b] even starting up. There are all kind of discussions going on and a lot of tips offered, but for someone not very computer savy it is too hard. Is it too much to ask to get a game that functions without adjusting all kind of system settings? If a game is still faulty don't put it up for sale, keep it in beta till you figure out what is wrong and FIX!!!!! it. 
So my advise is [b]DON'T BUY[/b] unless you have a degree in rocket science.
developer_response: Ensure that your computer meets the minimum requirements, posting the exact error message would be helpful, each computer is different. We will be able to help you if you open a thread in discussions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049127864', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1399, 'last_played': 1701488704}
review:
I adored this game back on the GameCube. A completely underrated gem I must add. I adored playing this as a child but I never had gotten around to finishing it and when I saw this pop up on steam, I just had to get it.

Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy is a 3d platformer along with some puzzle solving qualities, RPG elements and a collect-a-thon side quest; which is quite fun. Set in the Ancient Egyptian Mythos, you play as Sphinx for the most part, about 70% of the game is all about playing as Sphinx, the rest is all about the Mummy.

As Sphinx you do your usual 3d action platformer would do; Explore, Attack enemies, solve some small puzzles, doing some RPG stuff here and there, devling into dungeons and getting rewards. As the Mummy, it is highly emphasised on puzzle solving, but in a funny and entertaining manner; from being set on fire, electricuted, squished into a paper thin version of yourself or even cut into three Mummies!

The Atmosphere of the game is breath-taking, especially that this game was out in 2003 where most games on average didn't look or play that well compared to this. Instead of the usual pale yellow, sandy colour you'd get from the likes of Prince of Persia or any other game that is set in the Desert or is Egyptian themed, Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy has a wide arrange of colours that burst out from the dunes and even the night sky, from maroon red to deep cosmic blue.

The soundtrack is just awe inspiring, absolutely magnificent and fits the Egyptian theme down to a T. From the relaxing tune when you read from your journal to the attentive and choir-like intro music when you boot the game up. It is a must listen.

However, I do not own a controller when I'd played Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy on the PC so I had to resort to playing it with the Keyboard and Mouse. It didn't harbour any difficulties when playing mind you, merely trying to get used to the controls at first was a bit jarring but luckily the beginning of the game lets you test things out.

But for those that don't have the patience to delve into any of the default key binds, here's a quickie:

TAB =  use, open, etc
ESC = crawl/stand
F = attack
SPACE = jump

With all that said, this is a must play for those looking for a 3d platformer or just something Egyptian themed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112505503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 889, 'last_played': 1517976763}
review: I loved playing this game on xbox! I wish you could change the controls to better fit with keyboard, but if you have a controller that works on your computer, i’m sure it will work fine. The mummy character is the best!

author: {'steamid': '76561198078138538', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1118, 'last_played': 1681795212}
review: Simply amazing. I played this game a lot on the PS2 as a kid (I still have it to this day), and it was incredibly fun. This remaster is remarkable, and works very well! I did encounter a few glitches here and there, like repeating sound effects, but those bugs were fixed rather quickly by the developers. Although it's a little short, and I beat it in only a few days, I still definitely recommend anyone to play this. If you like Zelda, and Egyption Mythology interests you, play this now. It is very much worth the 15 dollars!

author: {'steamid': '76561198847690796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1141, 'last_played': 1690436345}
review:
Absolutely love this game! If you played the original one 15 years ago, then you have to play it again in full HD. I thought the graphics were amazing back then. This remastered version blew my mind.

It's the same exact game with a much sharper image. Attention to detail was top notch in the original game and in this version, all that is intensely amplified. Sound, music, and game play is identical to the original one.

I was able to play this on my laptop with a wired Xbox controller to the USB port and an HDMI cable to the big screen in my living room with the surround sound. Immerse yourself in this wonderful game. I really hope they make a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091894221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1194, 'last_played': 1617021248}
review:
Sphinx et la malédiction de la momie est un jeu que l'on m'avait offert sur Gamecube à l'époque et après l'avoir terminé, je ne l'avais plus ressorti depuis. Bien que la console et le jeu sont dans un carton et dont j'ai la flemme en plus d'un manque de place de les ressortir, j'ai pris sa version PC.

Tout de suite, j'ai retrouvé mes marques d'une manière générale, que ce soit par rapport à son environnement que pour son gameplay. 

Gameplay toutefois original puisqu'il se décompose en deux parties: la première, vous la jouez avec le personnage de Sphinx qui sera le perso avec qui vous allez passer le plus de temps, aussi bien pour découvrir les lieux que pour ses quêtes annexes, les minis-jeux et combats de boss. Tandis que l'autre gameplay se fera avec la momie qui, elle, est capable de supporter tous les pièges du secteur en question pour activer des interrupteurs et récupérer divers objets nécessaires pour la suite. 
Vous allez faire "souffrir" cette momie (elle s'en fout, elle est déjà morte, ha ha) en la faisant brûler, écrabouiller ou bien l’électrocuter et toujours avec de l'humour que ce soit pour son personnage que pour ses musiques durant ces phases.

L'histoire est prenante, on a envie de continuer à en savoir un peu plus, bien que la quête principale se fait assez rapidement. Le jeu ne surpassera pas, bien entendu, un Legend Of Zelda et d'un côté, ce n'était pas trop le but. On voit que les studios ont voulus faire leur propre jeu sans chercher à copier untel ou untel, faire un jeu en posant les bases d'un univers et de voir si cela marcherait au niveau du public.

Et ils avaient prévus le coup, dans l'éventualité, où cela marcherait puisque la fin du jeu faisait comprendre qu'il y aurait une suite: suite qui ne verra jamais le jour, ce qui est assez décevant. Pourtant, il y a du potentiel pour la suite d'un point de vue histoire car certaines questions restent encore sans réponse à la fin du titre.

Le jeu est très bon dans l'ensemble, les lieux sont magnifiques (j'aime énormément Héliopolis pour ma part), les personnages répondent très bien, des musiques superbes, une histoire prenante et des minis-quêtes optionnelles qui rallongent la durée du titre.

C'est un jeu que je recommande les yeux fermés.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173305378', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1577833398}
review: After about 14 years, I still cannot believe how somebody could come up with such a game. I've spent countless hours on the PS2 playing this game, even though I didn't understand English, it was still quite entertaining. I actually would say that this game has aged well and still looks amazing, even in 2018. For a game that was made in 2003 in my mind it had the BEST animations, the BEST graphics and most remarkably the BEST story for it's era, and I still think even in 2018 "Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy" has the best story of any fantasy, or adventure game. And I love the mythological creatures, and the scenic views, but now in HD. Sad that the game hasn't got a lot of attention. I personally would love a Sequel, but I think the story ended quite well and if any reboot would come out and not be that good, then I'll be dammed, I would be sad. So let's keep it this way.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984565694', 'num_games_owned': 441, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 10643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2240, 'last_played': 1666413794}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044560888', 'num_games_owned': 275, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2409, 'last_played': 1697089418}
review:
Definitely a pretty good remaster of a sadly-overlooked game from 2003. Swyter-- the sole person responsible for developing this remaster at the time of writing, as far as I know, which is impressive-- often updates the game and regularly interacts with the community, and it has mod support courtesy of the tools used to make the original game (that's the free Authoring Tools DLC)!

Give this a shot if you like games similar to Zelda, enjoy some brain-teasing puzzles, and/or want to mess around with things. And be sure to spread the word if you like it-- it shouldn't be ignored a second time. I do recommend a controller, though; there's no keyboard remapping right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045008079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1703306244}
review:
I have loved this game since its release 15 years ago! It's lovely in its stylized ancient Egyptian art. There's a monster collection, scarab beetle currency use, puzzle-solving, melee attack, switch between two characters along the plot, thematic music, and several other USE items along the way like elemental blow darts and special use beetles. 

There are several locations that you visit such as a town where you trade and purchase game items, egyptian temples for puzzles and battles, and a two-sided area where you visit various characters for plot and learning new abilities. 

For keyboard users if you dont have a controller:

TAB = X (use, open, etc)
ESC = Y (crawl/stand)
F = B (attack)
SPACE = A (jump)

I haven't gotten far enough along for LB and RB yet lol, but If you have a mouse that allows custom quick keys, it was much easier to set the mouse buttons to tab, esc, F, etc to play the game. :)

Original playtime on PS2 for me was about 16 hrs to collect everything (I was 10 and slow :D ), but otherwise the game is easily beatable in 8-12 hrs probably.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018982571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1528320022}
review:
After starting the game I realized that there is no way to reasonably control the character with a keyboard.
It was made for a hand controller only. There is no way to switch it to keyboard control.
The gamelooks like it could be a fun play but.... 
Also I didn't see any indication that this game was not PC compatable, requiring a controller.
developer_response:
There is preliminary keyboard support since launch day, and you can actually play from start to finish using just mouse and keyboard.

Take a look at this pinned thread in Discussions: https://steamcommunity.com/app/606710/discussions/0/1483235412204767496/

The only thing to keep in mind is that you won't see the key prompts or layout in-game, but you can customize most keybindings via configuration files. We are working on having actual in-game keybinding support, but as Sphinx was originally released as a console exclusive it entails rewriting big parts of the input code. So it may take a while.

We have received reports of people completing the game without using a gamepad, and while not ideal, seems to be perfectly doable. Let me know if that helps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119027107', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1284, 'last_played': 1701387833}

author: {'steamid': '76561197982020470', 'num_games_owned': 2191, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 936, 'last_played': 1527804165}
review:
Remasterización del juego de PS2/GC/Xbox. Sphinx y la Maldita Momia (anda que vaya tela con la traducción del título) es un juego que bebe bastante de Zelda. Está dividido en dos partes jugables: unas con Sphinx, más enfocada a la acción (aunque con puzles del tipo de pulsar interruptores y conseguir llaves) y otras con la momia, sin combates pero con mazmorras con más chicha.

Los segmentos con Sphinx son los principales (por algo da nombre al juego), y viajaremos por distintas zonas aumentando nuestro catálogo de armas y habilidades, lo que nos dará acceso a nuevas zonas. El sistema de combate es el punto flojo del juego. A pesar de basarse en Zelda, no se ha implementado un sistema de Z-targering, y la cámara no acompaña. Además, hay un escudo, pero es lento de usar y clava a Sphinx al suelo, así que salvo algunos enemigos, no será de gran utilidad. Un sistema de lucha bastante torpón, pero realmente la gracia del juego son sus puzles, por suerte.

Las partes de la momia, aunque al principio parezcan secundarias, acaban siendo de lo más divertidas. Hay mazmorras muy chulas, y las habilidades de la momia hacen que resolver los puzles sea muy gratificante. Al no poder morir, la momia puede usar su propio cuerpo sin miedo alguno (recordando a Wario Land, por ejemplo). Así, nos quemamos o nos electrocutaremos para superar los diversos acertijos.

Gráficamente no está mal para ser un juego relativamente antiguo, y hace unos días han actualizado con texturas HD, y se nota la mejora. Es cierto que me han saltado algunos bugs (por ejemplo, al principio del juego me bloquee con un objeto y tuve que reiniciar, u otra vez que el sonido petardeaba y hasta que no reinicié no se arregló), pero son cosas muy puntuales. Las melodías están bien, y no dispone de voces de ningún tipo (salvo los típicos gruñidos al golpear o saltar).

Una cosa que no me ha gustado nada es el tema del guardado, y sobre todo, la muerte. Al morir, no regresas a un punto de checkpoint o a la puerta de la mazmorra, sino que vuelves al último guardado. Al principio me cogió desprevenido y por un descuido tuve que repetir bastante juego, ya que solo me preocupaba de guardar cuando iba a dejar de jugar. A partir de entonces, he ido guardado cada rato, pero se hace tedioso, hay veces que vas con el miedo de que te maten por cualquier tontería y repetir los últimos 20 minutos. Y teniendo en cuenta que el sistema de combate no es el mejor, y que hasta bastante avanzada la aventura no puedes aumentar tu nivel de vida, si te descuidas con algún enemigo pueden matarte con facilidad. No es un juego difícil, pero hay secciones que no son bondadosas con el jugador, especialmente si por cualquier motivo avanzas con la salud baja (no es fácil recuperar vida).

Tampoco me ha gustado que al final del juego te metan en un punto sin retorno. Es cierto que te avisan de que a partir de cierto momento no vas a poder regresar, pero como no puedes copiar slots, al final vas a tener que avanzar y guardar sin poder regresar. Puedes meterte en la zona final y no guardar allí, pero aun así, sigue siendo un problema de diseño (si te mata el jefe final, tendrías que repetir todo el tramo final en ese caso). Y bueno, qué decir del final, lo dejan abierto de cara a una futura secuela que en su momento nunca llegó.

A pesar de la simpleza del combate y los problemas que estoy comentando (que realmente es por aportar algo negativo, no empañan demasiado el juego), me he divertido mucho y me ha teletransportado a una época donde este tipo de aventuras abundaban. Me ha durado unas 15 horas (y me he dejado muchas sidequest por el camino), y nunca me he aburrido, me ha tenido enganchado de principio a fin. Hay mazmorras muy chulas, especialmente con la momia. Muy recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011598064', 'num_games_owned': 1282, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 1054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1054, 'last_played': 1527761830}

author: {'steamid': '76561198402859797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1525726156}
review: my game wont even work anymore
developer_response:
If the game worked before you can still play it by reverting to an older version.

Accessing older Sphinx versions is pretty easy; go to your Steam library, right-click on the game > Properties > go to the Betas tab in the Properties dialog and pick a date from the drop-down menu. Try newer versions first and go backwards, most of those should do the trick.

If you open a thread in the Steam forums telling us what is the latest version that works for you we can figure out why that happens.

Hope that helps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045318962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1668415918}
review:
Never thought I'd see this game again, though I had long hoped.

It's really great and of the "buddy game" variety of yore; like Jak & Daxter meets Zelda, only the Mummy and Sphinx aren't playable at the same time. Lots of good puzzles, humor, setting, music, etc.

I do wish they'd opted for voice acting, though and I hope the devs improve some aspects of the game like hit detection on ziplines or the camera. The game also uses a save-point system that was antiquated even back in '03. I also wish that for the Sphinx parts of the game, they had just ripped off Ocarina of Time's lock-on system as combat is kind of unwieldy.

I also see they released a modkit for the game via proprietary Eurocom software, so I can't wait to see what new stuff the community will create for the game — I think this may be the first, or at least one of the very few, console games that has had official mod tools released for it when they could've easily gone the DLC route.

Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042303317', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1687423471}
review: A classic from my childhood with a somewhat modern port and minimal issues. Only had one hard crash so far but it has not stopped me from enjoying this lovely artifact I had long thought to be dead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368734133', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 946, 'last_played': 1516729898}
review:
Un jeu d'action à la troisième personne un peu ~old school qui sait proposer une aventure sympathique à défaut de transcendante.
L'idée de contrôler à tour de rôle deux personnages qui ont chacun leurs compétences et faiblesses est intéressante bien qu'un peu sous-exploitée vu qu'on ne peut jouer la Momie qu'à des moments bien précis de l'intrigue. C'est d'autant plus dommage qu'il s'agit du personnage qui a le gameplay le plus intéressant, notamment lorsqu'on se penche sur ses différentes transformations. 
Je regrette principalement qu'il n'y ait pas de réelle difficulté au niveau des combats (les boss sont tout simplement risibles à battre) et que la plupart des objets à récupérer ne servent au final pas à grand chose. Malgré cela, le jeu sait rester assez diversifié pour se montrer intéressant même s'il s'effoufle à quelques reprises et certaines trouvailles (notamment l'idée de pouvoir capturer des monstres pour ensuite les utiliser pour détruire des obstacles ou déverouiller des secrets) donnent au jeu une touche sympathique. Bonus pour les succès Steam à gagner.
Pas le jeu du siècle, somme toute, mais qui n'a pas la prétention d'être autre chose qu'une aventure mi-épique mi-déjantée inspirée par la mythologie égyptienne. Fini en quinze/seize heures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107289581', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1660472452}

Au final tout ça pour dire : A quand la suite ?

author: {'steamid': '76561197999754957', 'num_games_owned': 1152, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1640106227}
review:
An ALL time classic. i use to play this game back in the day on the gamecube. its an older game and you REALLY need a controller to play this. but if you are lacking on some amazing platformers and ancient egypt done right. then this is the game for you. puzzles are definitly amazing in this game and the controles for them are almost just as good.

last thing for a game that was made in 2003 it looks amazingly good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999899413', 'num_games_owned': 5069, 'num_reviews': 344, 'playtime_forever': 1143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1143, 'last_played': 1515729279}
review:
I never played this game when it originally came out and decided to pick it up because it seemed like something I would enjoy, and I wasn't wrong. This is an action/platformer/puzzle game that came out back in the day of the games like Jak & Daxer or Ratchet and Clank that has criminally low recognition. The  puzzles in this game are phenomenal and really make you think because they often are designed across the entire dungeon or map. I loved the utilization of the mummy in the dungeons. I've played a nice amount of platformers from this era of games, and some of them had puzzle elements, but not to many have had puzzles that were designed this beautifully. The theme is wonderful and the characters are fun placesetters to help put you in the world that you will be running around in. From what I've seen of the original game, the graphics have been overhauled making it really great to look at. The controls are really nice and you never feel like a missed jump or rough landing was the games fault. Best played with a controller. Another great feature was that your saves are backlogged, so if something messes up or you miss something important and can't go back like an achievement, you can make one of your backlogged saves a save from the game just by changing a name in the saves folder. You will easily sink almost 20 hours into this game just beating and completing it and if you really enjoy it, like most of the people who picked this up for the nostalgia, than I'm sure you'll play it again. Well worth the $15 usd or anything less you can pick up on a sale. Maybe there's a hope that the second one can get funded because of this remasters positive reception.

[quote=Crimson-Albedo]Follow my reviews through my curator at [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/32482033/]Crim's Humble Opinion[/url][/quote]

review: Literally such a beautiful game for its time, it’s one of my childhood favorites. The puzzles are pretty easy but they are still very interesting and original. 10/10 would recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198028880390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1069, 'last_played': 1515077048}
review: A diamond in the rough still recommended for fans of Zelda-style action-adventure games.  The big draw here is undoubtedly the dungeon level design, which is full of extremely clever puzzles that often extend across multiple rooms and require quite a bit of thought and experimentation to work out.  The Egyptian setting is also quite nice.  Less good are the camera (which is awful) and the combat controls, which aren't nearly as fluid as one might like.  Fortunately, since the emphasis is on puzzling, combat only occasionally gets in the way of the fun.  Definitely worth it for the bargain price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128898222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1097, 'last_played': 1669480806}
review:
FInalmente dopo decenni posso dire di averlo finito, l'ho iniziato ai tempi, quando avevo 13 anni, e non lo ho mai finito.
Sphinx e La Mummia Pasticciona, il suo titolo in Italiano.

Questo gioco é un intrigante puzzle in un universo in tema Egizio, dove dei, semi-dei e mortali si scontrano per ottenere potere e vita eterna. Farmaggio Scarabei, Catturare Mostri e molto altro.

Mi sono commosso quando sono riuscito a superare il blocco che avevo da bambino ed ero riuscito a raggiungere per parlare con una divinitá in particolare, e il finale merita, come d'altronde tutto il gioco.

Alcuni pezzi del gioco sono attualmente complessi pure per me, ma con perseveranza ce la si fá.

9/10 - Lo Raccomando dopo un'attenta visione di un primo gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029365007', 'num_games_owned': 879, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1545, 'last_played': 1515274649}
review:
This is a good port and the gameplay and humor still hold up despite the game being over 10 years old at this point.
Playing as sphinx the gameplay clearly takes alot from The Legend of Zelda but the puzzle sections where you play as the mummy are in my opinion where the the game really shines. Despite the puzzle sections being platforming the puzzle and the solutions are very creative and fun to play even on a second or third run through the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198443917219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 136946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1061, 'last_played': 1708176328}
review:
Stunning visuals, charming character animation and fantastic story. 

Sphinx and the cursed mummy also offers lots of little minigames and small quests to do if you have beaten or finished the game, or you can do them while you're in the middle of the game. 
They're fun, addictive just like the entire game itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019361016', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1641734050}
review:
Super Spiel, hab es früher auf dem GameCube gespielt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075943758', 'num_games_owned': 575, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 14405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 77, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1711856343}
review: Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy is such an amazing game, my mother and I used to play it when I was only about 6 years old on the PS2. I've been emulating it, playing it on the PS2, being part of and one of the top editors on the Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy Wikia. I've taken so many High-Res pictures for the Wikia the past 2 years. Love the mystery, art style, gameplay, storyline and almost everything. I'm so grateful THQ Nordic would take the fans requests, including myself and try to remaster an old gem to feel like it just released in 2017 and not 2003. Even to this day, the graphics are stunning for it's age and I believe it ages well, the developer that released this "Remaster" is doing a very good job with listening to the community, and fixing the HUD bugs. (It Is VERY Recommended in my opinon that you use a controller with this game for the best experience.) I could go on for a long time talking about everything I love about this game, and how much you should love it too, but I'll stop here. Thank you so much, THQ Nordic for giving Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy another shot in the spotlight, even if it still doesn't "top the records". I'll forever appreciate it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092260575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1703567437}
review:
Whenever a game like this comes out, It's a hidden gem, locked away behind other popular games.
This is the game that made my childhood and I appreciated this game more than anything, I recommend this game for everyone, if you like Action and Adventure mixed in with puzzle solving, I recommend.
The animation is still as great with the characters having real quality and creativity put into each and every one.
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198246036864', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1197, 'last_played': 1688808351}
review:
I remember playing this game throughout the mid 2000's and beating the game around 3 times on both XBox and PS2 and was very glad to see the game remastered for the PC where I am working on my 4th playthrough. From a nostalgic point of view I love this game but I can see what would turn people off from it. The game has its fair share of flaws but in my opinion none of them are outright deal breakers and arguably make the game more satisfying to complete as they provide an element of challenge that is not too often seen in games released in recent years. I would recommend this game to more than just the nostalgic old players on the condition that they don't mind the following constraints:

- The controls in this game are ported over from XBox and are not the easiest to use on PC which can make the game irritating at times. I would strongly advise bookmarking a page online that has the controls aswell considering there are no real ways to determine what button does what in game.On a side note if you have a controller you will likely have an easier time.

- There is quite a bit of backtracking in this game and the objectives may not always be spelled out for you or outright obvious so it is a smart idea to actually pay attention to the story, explore the zones and make note of stuff you may not be able to do ingame yet.

- The level design is not the greatest at times, some jumps will seem impossible but are just in fact very difficult, making full use of the double jump feature obtained early on in the game.

- There are bugs in this game however most of them have been fixed however I will post 2 that I encountered for the sake of awareness: 
+ Left eyes of sarcophagi are invisible
+ A rare bug where conversation is inescapable and uninteracable with the NPC that runs the Heliopolis obstacle course.

- Voice acting is pretty much non-existant outside of incomprehensable noises made by the characters in cutscenes. 

Despite the game's buggy behavior It has solid replay value and is a great fit for anyone that liked to play older action-adventure platformer games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992123547', 'num_games_owned': 1604, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 1009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 967, 'last_played': 1643431425}
review:
Hello everybody, End World Gaming here to share an excerpt from my review for Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy HD by Eurocom and THQNordic.

Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy HD is a remaster of an action adventure game from 2003. As of writing this review the game has only been released on PC but I hope that the game will receive a console release (Again) in the future so more people can enjoy the game.

The game is based on Ancient Egyptian mythology and it features many of the gods and heroes from the time period, like Imhotep and Anubis.

The story follows two characters, the first is named Sphinx and he’s used mostly for combat, while Tutankhamen is used to solve intricate puzzles. The game frequently alternate’s between the two of them and in doing so it makes the game a lot less boring.

Each area of the game is beautifully designed and the HD enhancements look great considering the game’s age. Most of the areas are quite large as well and often have side quests for you to complete. Doing side quests also has benefits to the game itself but there are some that aren’t required to complete the game, like capturing monsters for the museum, as an example.

As you progress through the game the puzzles that you encounter with Tutankhamen become increasingly more intricate and complex. Since he’s a mummy for the majority of the game, he’s immune to death and this fact is utilized in each of the game’s puzzles. He can be set on fire, electrocuted, split into 3, and flattened. Each of these unique states lasts only for a short period of time so you must move quickly to solve each of the game’s puzzles. If he’s on fire or electrified, falling into the water will get rid of the effect and you’ll need to go reacquire it again. Getting any of the effects will also automatically replace the existing effect too.

When you’re in control of sphinx you’ll be able to use the Sword of Osiris to battle enemies. Enemies come in many shapes and sizes and each have their own unique abilities to them. They’re pretty limited in skills though, so you can easily learn their moves without much effort.

At the start of the game, Sphinx’s skills are pretty limited but as you complete major points in the story, he’ll acquire items that grant bonus abilities such as fast swimming and double jumping.

Overall, Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy HD is a very entertaining game and the developers did a great job on the remastering of it. There are some minor issues that I ran into like the usage of items being rather cumbersome and until recently the font being too small (Which has now been fixed thankfully). Outside of those, I’ve been having a lot of fun with the game and I look forward to finishing up my video playthrough of the game. If you’re a fan of action adventure games and want something that’ll take up a lot of your time then Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy HD is a great choice.

If you're interested in checking out my full review or to find out my final score, you can find the review here: http://www.endworldgaming.com/action-adventure/sphinx-and-the-cursed-mummy-hd-reviews

Thanks for taking the time to check out the review folks and happy gaming!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071156241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 895, 'last_played': 1693789210}
review:
As soon as I saw this on Steam I bought it for the full £15 and have been playing it since, I had some gripes to start with such as missing effects and some visual elements that didn't follow the art style of the original game but I thought those would be fixed, patch after patch later the game runs worse looks the same and the developer Swyter has no want to represent the game in it's original form, removing shading and lighting replacing it with basic flat shading

Swyter did implement original art assets but these clash horribly with the low resolution art that is still from the PS2, high resolution source artwork was lazily pasted onto the game world with no thought of how it looks next to a texture made for a console with 32Mb of RAM, combine this with the ugly shading and you have a game that looks like a bad texture pack rather than a remaster

All I need do is compare Swyter's port to the PS2 version running in PCSX2, this port is an insult to the original game and is not how you should play this game, grab yourself a PS2 ISO and play it on PCSX2 at 4K 60FPS with the original graphics intact, this isn't a bad port but it's a lazy quick cash grab by THQNordic done by a programmer who can't control his ego.

PC vs PCSX2
https://u.teknik.io/ymoKG.png

author: {'steamid': '76561198071238441', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1513615021}
review: When I was a kid, I had a very small selection of games to go with my PS2.  Among that collection were games that many declared to be the worst of their series.  Spyro: Enter the Dragonfly, Crash Bandicoot: Warped, for example.  My collection is not without its gems; however, because it had this game.  This game was really fun.  It still is really fun, even though the controls are really whacked out and I feel like I'm fighting the awkward keyboard controls as much as I'm fighting the enemies.  Regardless, the devs said they were working on custom keybinds.  If you played this game as a kid, or even if you didn't, I'd recommend trying it out.  The puzzles are fun, the enemies are gough but fair, and the story is good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081153164', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1691873838}
review:
Dear. Lord. I am so extremely happy that this game was brought back. I really am. I had this game as a kid, and i even still have my old physical official strategy guide book for it. 
I remember as a kid, the only flaw i ever saw with the game was the save breaking bug early in the game, where you would save, exit, come back and the only door that leads to the next part is perma closed. This has been fixed, along with LITERALLY every bug that has been brought to the developers attention thus far. 
Also pro-tip, if you see any negative reviews from a previous date than this with the reason being a bug, it's already been fixed. Everythings been fixed. The developer is a saint when it comes to making this game proper for pc, he has been working extremely diligently to make sure all bugs are patched ASAP. Want an example? I came across a bug that after a death made my game unplayable because of black screen. I posted on the forums about it, and LITERALLY within 3 minutes the developer responded, recieved the information, and within the day the bug was patched. 
THIS IS AN AMAZING CLASSIC  GEM OF AN ADVENTURE GAME. IT IS 100% WORTH YOUR MONEY. IF YOU HAVE THE MONEY, AND ARE LOOKING FOR A NEW GAME TO TRY, THIS IS THE GAME YOU NEED TO PLAY. 
Don't play on keyboard and mouse though, get a controller. Keyboard controls are hard to use for movement, and the mouse controls for the camera is horrible too. BUT HEY ITS ORIGINALLY A CONSOLE GAME. IF YOU AINT PLAYING WITH A CONTROLLER YOU AINT DOING IT RIGHT ;o 
10/10 purely amazing classic that was revived on steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971628333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 1132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1132, 'last_played': 1511314157}
review:
[b][u]Summary[/u][/b]
[i]Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy[/i] is a surprising title to see remastered but it is a welcome surprise. Its strong 3D puzzle platforming and sense of nostalgia will endear it to a niche audience. Remnants of old game designs may frustrate those looking for a modern experience. Poor keyboard controls are hopefully only a temporary flaw in this otherwise good quality port. 

[h1]Pros:[/h1][list]
[*]Puzzles that continually introduce fresh mechanics
[*]Great pacing between Sphinx and Tutankhamen sections
[*]Vibrant colors and character animations
[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1][list]
[*]Story never deviates from what you'd expect
[*]No autosave function; semi-infrequent save points
[*]Small moments of frustration add up
[/list]

[b][u]Expanded Review[/u][/b]
Even as a newcomer to [i]Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy[/i] I felt pangs of nostalgia from playing it. Not because I recognized anything but because its designs and features felt so familiar. It is a puzzle action platformer that draws obvious inspiration from the [i]Zelda[/i] series. Coming from an era predating physics based puzzles ([i]Half Life 2[/i] would be released a year later) means you'll be solving puzzles with good old switches, buttons and an ever growing selection of equipment and environmental factors.

As the title suggests you'll be splitting your time between playing as Sphinx, the lion tailed hero, and Tutankhamen, the cursed mummy. The pacing is excellent as you swap between the two at predetermined times in the story. Sphinx plays like a hero should. He swings a sword, double jumps like a champ and knows how to use the tools he finds. And he does it all with a confident air and swagger in his step.

Meanwhile Tutankhamen, once called "the Misfortunate Mummy" in the title, plays the slapstick comic relief. He is imprisoned from early on and his mission is one of stealth and thievery. There is no combat in his sections and item use is limited. Instead he uses his undead body as a tool. Among other things, he can be lit on fire, smashed flat and sawed into pieces. For all his misfortune he keeps a cheery demeanor.

With a launch price of 14.99$ and a run time averaging around 16 hours I'd call this a solid value for a niche audience. It took me just over 18 hours to 100% complete it. It will primarily appeal to those of us that were gaming back in 2003. Those looking for more 3D puzzle dungeon delving outside of the Zelda series should also find enjoyment in it.

[i]Edit: link removed from the now defunct PC Aficionado website.[/i]
[strike]See the full review with scores and screenshots at [link removed].[/strike]

author: {'steamid': '76561197982567635', 'num_games_owned': 746, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1706132008}
review:
Solid port job! Currently playing on my mid-range HTPC with a Geforce 1050ti and I'm running the game at 4K with 32x AA! Maintains rock solid 60fps. Very impressive. 0 jaggies!

As far as the game itself, it lives up to my memories. It still plays and looks like the budget title it was in 2003 though. Some rough edges and a lot of the same textures used way too much. If you can look past that, the combat and puzzles are a lot of fun! Character animation is a joy, I love the Mummy thumbs-up after getting major items.


Only gripe is having achievements for the museum. That was an utter grind in the original release, and I don't want to do that again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000310010', 'num_games_owned': 2099, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 4270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2303, 'last_played': 1642639651}
review:
A train!
A train of emotions filled me as the game ended.
After 36.6h of gameplay (totalled to 16:57 ingame) the game ended and I feel sad cause it's over.
It's been a great experience. A great hd port on pc of a great game I was waiting since my childhood to play on Gamecube but couldn't find a copy.
Great graphics. Great gameplay. Great port. Great all.
And most of all, a great interaction with Swyter, the programmer and PC conversion person, that ported the game to us, first on the HD texture pack for GC, then here on PC.
He has been a great help fixing the bugs in the first week of release and more. He come to the discord server too highlighting us with more and more. Was a pleasure helping him also ironing out the italian translation (which had some little hiccups but nothing major).
Thanks to Swyter and THQ Nordic for the great game. Go and grab it now if you haven't yet!

author: {'steamid': '76561198282169192', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1498, 'last_played': 1590526785}
review:
Ist es wirklich schon 14 Jahre her, dass ich dieses Spiel gespielt habe? Hätte nie gedacht, Sphinx und die Mumie wiederzusehen, und so war es eine wundervolle Überraschung, als ich das Spiel hier bei Steam entdeckt habe. Ich kann nur sagen, trotz des Alters sieht es immernoch gut aus und macht genausoviel Spaß wie damals. Wer Spaß an Rätseln hat, gern um ein paar Ecken denkt und dazu noch Platforming- und Action-Elemente haben möchte, kann mit diesem Spiel nicht viel falsch machen. Dazu kommen ein toller Soundtrack, zwei liebenswerte Hauptfiguren und (gerade auf Seiten der Mumie) einige der schrägsten Gameplay-Ideen, die mir je untergekommen sind. Ich würde aber einen Controller empfehlen, da die Steuerung definitiv darauf ausgelegt ist. Da die Devs aber sehr aktiv sind und Probleme und Vorschläge der Spieler wirklich ernst nehmen, kann das inzwischen schon anders sein. Die Begeisterung und Hingabe der Devs lässt mich auch tatsächlich auf eine Fortsetzung hoffen. Oder auf andere Spiele, die wir alle schon auf dem Friedhof der Inkompatibilität gesehen haben.

Danke THQ Nordic für dieses Wiedersehen mit einem alten Freund. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198065000145', 'num_games_owned': 1872, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1032, 'last_played': 1631953978}
review:
Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy.
Wow. I never thought i would see the day that one of my favourite games of all time would be on steam!!
Think of this as Zelda but with a heavy inspiration of Egyptian mythology.
Play as Sphinx , a warrior who must fulfil an ancient prophecy to save the world.
Play as the Mummy , Formerly Prince Tutankhamen.
Sphinx is the action side of the game and the mummy is the puzzle aspects.
Both very engaging and thought provoking.
If you have never played this game .. what are you waiting for ?

author: {'steamid': '76561198035595681', 'num_games_owned': 1834, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1318, 'last_played': 1596985427}
review: Great game for those who played it when it originally came out and fairly decent puzzle and adventure game for those who enjoy that type of gameplay. Nothing to difficulty in the game which makes it an easy enough play through. Most of the initial game bugs have been fixed and I never encountered any game breaking bugs. I would recommend playing with a controller just due to the nature of the game as well as a prominent game mechanic that was clearly designed for use with a joystick when it first came out. I know there making adjustment to allow for custom control mapping but honestly I say it’s much easier to play on a controller and its well optimised for it as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054353969', 'num_games_owned': 698, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1699639247}
review: I first found this game back on the GameCube and fell in love with it. I've always been a fan of Zelda and Ancient Egypt so when I found a game that combined them both I knew I'd found something special. I've probably put over a hundred hours in total across the GameCube version and now this version on Steam. Sure the game has some flaws what game doesn't, but they are few and far between. The soundtrack is amazing and I'm glad I can now easily own it. I still hold out hope for a sequel even though I know it will probably never happen so for now I'll just keep playing this and loving every moment of it.

Fantastic soundtrack and environments. The port itself is perfect, 60 fps, no glitches at all. And ultrawide support too <3

author: {'steamid': '76561197997128499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1694739435}
review:
I'll start by saying that the game-breaking bug you're worrying about is fixed. That clear? Let's get to the review.

Port review:
+Looks great in HD, textures mostly still look good
+Tons of options to change the game to your liking
+Dev team has been appreciably responsive and quick to address reports
+Sweet baby Osiris, automatic save backups
-HUD and text are too small at higher resolutions, although a dev said this would be fixed
-Shadows are missing
-Occasional minor sound bugs
-Rare bug where talking to any NPC will softlock the game, forcing you to reload your save

Game review:
+Still holds up 14 years later
+Egyptian mythology is utilized quite well for the setting and lore, fits so seamlessly
+Well written story and characters if cliche
+Best Zelda clone I have played personally
+Great puzzles, decent combat
+Fantastic OST
-In retrospect the game isn't as dense as I remember, only about 10 hours long for 100%
-The bosses
-Sequel hook ending that still hasn't been resolved (unless a lot of people buy this remaster?!)

I wholeheartedly recommend picking up this game both for the quality of the game itself and to reward THQ Nordic's decision to bring it back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068352871', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1540334927}
review:
Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy will always have a special place in my little game collection, and will perhaps always be my favorite game of all time.. It was one of the first games I owned when I got my first console: the PS2 back in 2004. I remember having a selection of games to choose from including a new crash bandicoot game, but I choose this one to play along with my sister beside me. I remember it taking me around a year to complete, although I was very young at the time, but still kept me engaged straight the way through.

Part of the reason I fell in love with this game was the parts when I'd find a new area and be blown away every time the expanses the graphics of the time the monsters, RPG aspect it was all perfect. I was so happy to see the game remastered, and looking forward to playing through it again. Highly recommended for any zelda/open world fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089907009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 854, 'last_played': 1658281687}
review:
Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy is one of those games I got when it came out, and I loved it. It's one of the few games I held onto for all these years, and I still have my physical copy. 

As far as the porting goes, it seems really competent. I've been running into weird audio glitches (only about twice so far) where the last sfx will keep playing on repeat until replaced by another. (Ex: Getting hit plays the hit noise till it gets replaced with the noise for splashing in water, etc.) 

The gameplay itself is great. If you're looking for a puzzle-esque Zelda game that has a good solid pace and plenty to do, then you can do a lot worse than Sphinx. It's one of those games I hope does well, so THQ Nordic can justify making a new one and finishing up the story that was left dangling for the past 14 years.

EDIT: Apparently the studio has managed to fix the audio issues.

review: I have loved this game since I was a child and I figured i'd give the HD version a shot since i'm honestly happy to see any news about this game. The HD one has quite a few errors that are rather annoying; certain sounds don't work like footsteps, falling.etc, The controls feel like they've been kicked into overdrive and are clunky, there are issues with items popping up and rendering which get very annoying, and when you go into a sarcophagus the left eye vanishes and that's just from what I've played so far. The game still looks beautiful but I wish this had been a little more reviesed before it was put back out; I still like the game but at the end of the day I might just play it on my ps2 until the errors are fixed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992272991', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 988, 'last_played': 1689623686}
review:
I'm honestly impressed at the competency of this port. The only issues I have are extremely minor and are more than likely being patched out as we speak - the devs are quite actively working to fix things as they come. It runs great, I've never seen the FPS counter go below 60, and it looks amazing. Extra kudos go toward making a good Mac port. You don't see that very often, even now, and I haven't noticed any extra issues stemming from being on Mac over PC, which is rare.


As far as the game itself goes, it's one of my all-time faves. It's really fun, and it has a lot of charm. I thoroughly recommend anyone who enjoys zelda or prince of persia to give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198243783480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1512818403}

author: {'steamid': '76561198113665527', 'num_games_owned': 491, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1511042486}
review: I owned this game back in the day on the original Xbox. It was one of my favorite games back then, so when I saw that it was suddenly on steam, I just HAD to get it. Think Legend of Zelda meets ancient Egypt. You play as two different characters - a classic swordsman/adventurer achetype and the mummified remains of King Tut - and explore a vast world, slaying monsters, completing platforming dungeons, solving puzzles, and mingling with various Egyptian Gods. After playing through it all again, it's just as fun as I remember and looks great in HD for a game that's over a decade old.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107374681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1153, 'last_played': 1510795109}
review:
Não conhecia este jogo, mas resolvi arriscar a compra em virtude das muitas avaliações positivas que encontrei por aí. Seu estilo tem um "quê" de Spyro, por isso tenho gostado dele. 

Quanto às "qualidades", posso apontar: divertido e desafiador; gráficos razoáveis; boa trilha sonora; quebra-cabeças de média dificuldade; vários inimigos (alguns bem chatos); e enredo interessante.

Quanto aos "defeitos", até o momento, lembro-me apenas da ausência de voz dos personagens e do tamanho das legendas (bem diminutas), fatores que causam estranheza no início do jogo. Até o momento, ocorreu apenas um "bug" aleatório em que a tela ficou absolutamente escura, sendo necessário recarregar o "save".

PS: ao iniciar o jogo, tome cuidado para não selecionar acidentalmente "New Game" pensando que é "Load Game" e, assim, apagar o save. Isso ocorreu comigo porque fui apressado... Porém, como estava no início do jogo, não tive maiores problemas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037788913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1196, 'last_played': 1561030643}
review:
1)  Review in English(1) and German(2)

1) 1
Yesterday in the Eve, while i was surfing through the Internet, I randomly saw this Game.
My Favourite Playstation 2 Game ! I was excited like a little kid on Christmas haha ! Was it Fate ? However... 

This HD Remake looks beautiful, the ambient atmosphere is gorgeous and the music quality much better than I had it in my Memories
If you use ReShade, this game looks partially better than Assassins Creed !

But there a some things, that must be patched !

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1) 2

Gestern Abend, während ich im Internet surfte, sah ich aus Zufall dieses Spiel
Mein lieblings Playstation 2 Spiel ! I war aufgeregt wie ein kleines Kind an Weihnachten ! War es Schicksal ? Wie auch immer...

Dieses HD Remake sieht wirklich schön aus, die Umgebungs Atmosphäre echt herrlich und die Musik Qualität ist besser als ich sie in Erinnerung hatte.
Wenn man ReShade benutzt, sieht es teilweise besser aus als Assassins Creed !

Aber ein paar Dinge sollten wirklich gepatch werden !

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Patch List:

author: {'steamid': '76561197986511953', 'num_games_owned': 782, 'num_reviews': 311, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1709706568}
review:
Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy is a 3D platformer released by Eurocom. The same developer that made Crash Bash. It originally released back in 2003 on the PS2. It's set in a fantasy world inspired by ancient Egypt.

It's a very competent game. The levels look really nice, the characters have nice designs, the platforming is competent. But it doesn't really stand out in any real respect. The story is bog standard and generic and you really stop paying attention to it. At one point you unlock a second player character who is a mummy but all this really does is shift the game towards a more stealth focus. There is also no voice acting and this really drags the entire game down and makes it feel like it lacks personality compared to something like Jak and Daxter. 

Sphinx is interesting less because of it's value as a game but moreso how it was completely forgotten after it released and only gets discussed nowadays because of a massive oversight on the developers part with the original release. In the NTSC release, if you used a specific save game station. It locks a specific door you need to get through and makes you unable to complete the game. This massive technical problem affects almost everyone who played the original release and as a result very few people actually completed the game. 

This is why I'm somewhat shocked that this game was ported to PC 14 years later since I was surprised someone else remembered it. This version does fix that bug and is fairly competent aside from that. But that's the word, competent. It doesn't do very much you haven't seen done better elsewhere. It's one of the most average games I've ever played and unless you grew up with it I doubt you'd be interested in it otherwise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079498092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1539122609}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001454789', 'num_games_owned': 2182, 'num_reviews': 258, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1510785968}
review:
I can't believe this happened. Sphinx was one of my favourite games on the GameCube and after more than 10 years I can finally play it again.

Only 978 MB space required. It looks great, considering its age. Anti-Aliasing. 60 fps. It's cheap and even cheaper on sale right now. Why can't ports always be like this?

According to the Steam forums, lots of bugs have been fixed, the devs are going to add proper keymapping and fix the other issues (windowed mode, 1440p support,...) people are complaining about right now.

I've only played it for an hour so far, but as it was a great game back then and this is (will be) a great port, I clearly recommend it.

Show your support for good ports of classic games! After Jet Set Radio, Ty the Tasmanian Tiger and Sphinx we might have some great things coming.

Update: 
Apparently the broken windowed mode has been fixed already. The devs are actively communicating with the community, especially regarding technial issues. Thumbs up for that.

Update 2:
The dev (yes, this port is actually done by a single person) still pushes hotfixes nearly everyday. Unfinished beta levels (including whole new worlds) are going to be released as free DLC, possibly to be finished by modders. Guys, support!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032198644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1672858984}
review: Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy is a wonderful trip down mummy la... I mean memory lane. The game has been brought back to life with HD visuals that make it enjoyable to play once more. It is optimized fairly well for being a PC port, although you will notice from the start that the buttons are in console format. I highly recommend a controller as the keyboard and mouse can be rather clunky and difficult to use. Although Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy is a simplistic puzzle solver, it will appeal mostly to the old school gamer for its charm, nostalgia and humor we all grew up on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038397318', 'num_games_owned': 537, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1685917135}
review:
I was twelve when I got this game. It was my birthday and i was allowed to get 2 or 3 games for my PS2. I remember seeing the box art for this game and being fascinated. i had always had an interest in ancient Egypt, my favorite movie of the time was The Mummy, and i couldn't wait to get home and play it. I'm glad I did, too, Because it wound up becoming one of my top ten favorite games of all time. Fast forward to about two weeks ago. I find out that Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy is coming to PC. I haven't been so excited. I thinks it fair to say I love this game. However, I do have a few minor issues with this port.

First, the text is far too small. When i'm at my computer desk playing it's not that much of a problem. However, in the living room, on my big TV, it's impossible to read. I've also noticed a lot of artifacting and broken bits of letters in the text box. I hear that a fix is coming for that and I hope it's soon. 

Second, there seems to be a few minor graphical bugs. I'm running a GTX 1070, so i doubt it's my computers fault. A few cases of random things losing their eyes, one or both, and other cases of Sphinx's model nowhere near lined up with objects he's interacting with. Hopefully these issues can be fixed and if so, it will be done soon as well.

Overall, nothing I've noticed has been game breaking or messed up my experience with this port. They're all just little things I notice while playing that make me chuckle and wonder what happened. Sphinx continues to be a pleasure to play and seeing it in HD makes me that much happier. I look forward to seeing what the future holds for this IP and the others THQN have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198371376265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 95742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 68, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1712215083}
review:
¡Muy buen juego!

Muy divertido e interesante, comparándolo con el de la PS2 ha mejorado muchísimo en los gráficos. 

Lo recomiendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001408600', 'num_games_owned': 1760, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2818, 'last_played': 1519057255}
review:
I've been eagerly awaiting Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy since it was announced for re-release on the PC by THQ Nordic, it looks and feels just like I remember, however, on a 1440p monitor, the GUI elements are extremely small. It's good that they don't stretch unnaturally, but the subtitles and button display are quite small and currently have no options to increase them. Developer Swyter has confirmed on the Community Hub that this will be fixed. I've only experienced one minor freeze so far, but I think this happened when my Xbox Controller suddenly became disconnected from the computer. 

As mentioned above, it looks and feels just like how I remember, upon visiting a YouTube video for the original version on the Gamecube/PS2, it definitely has been improved! Then again, in all of our collective memories, childhood games always look better in our minds than they actually did in reality. I can see how certain elements have been made HD, and with 60fps support the game. it truly is nostalgia overload. 

I may come back and update this review as I progress through the game, as I am currently still in the early stages. Aside from the minor freeze I had, and the GUI elements looking tiny, I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this classic.

UPDATE: I have experienced some more freezes, these are rare and last for about half a second each time it happens, not sure as to the exact cause, it's a minor nuisance and something I can see genuinely affecting other players who may understandably not be so lenient towards issues such as these. Other reviewers have mentioned sound stuttering bugs, I hadn't experienced any of these until I reached the level where you play as Tut and must find the Moon, Sun and Earth Planetarium Keys. It seems to continue every now and then from this point, but it is sometimes fixed by pressing the Back button and then again to go back into gameplay. At one point, I had to restart the game to fix it. Minor issues, but this won't stop me from enjoying the game! Hopefully these minor annoyances get fixed.

UPDATE 2: The sound bug has now been fixed, I've only experienced very minor bugs since then and these do not affect gameplay. I'm nearing the end of the campaign and this has been an absolutely terrific nostalgic trip. Swyter has been extremely involved in the community in ensuring that everybody is able to play the game just as it was meant to be played, little bugs and big bugs have been ironed out and continue to be ironed out today. Very much worth the purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060588275', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1659381401}
review: Sphinx HD feels a bit buggy, there's no in game menu to remap controls, and you have to invert the Look to feel normal, as well as minimal menu options and the control scheme always tells you the XBOX stuff. This is a bit of an annoyance but will hopefully be patched, for me it's too good to pass up as this was my childhood. It's still a bit clunky but just as gorgeous as the original, doesn't feel too HD but it looks great and plays pretty good too! I reccomend playing with a controller until they fix some of the issues. Long live Sphinx!
